dialogueTree.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes, what is it?" She doesn't look..."
dialogueTree.text: "Yes, what is it?" She doesn't look up from the keyboard.

links.title: You: "Come up with a site for a mega-long..."
links.text: Come up with a site for a mega-longwave radio antenna.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Close your eyes. Unfold your mental..."
links.text: Close your eyes. Unfold your mental map of Martinaise. It's morning. You're standing on the plaza before the Whirling-in-Rags.

links.title: Shivers: "The wind pushes a piece of tare acr..."
links.text: The wind pushes a piece of tare across the cracked tiles. From the north comes the malicious laughter of two children...

links.title: You: "Turn to face the bay."
links.text: Turn to face the bay.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Your eye follows the tiles west. Yo..."
links.text: Your eye follows the tiles west. You see a bench and a few twisted, pitiful trees. Then, just water...

links.title: Shivers: "The voice again, more urgent now: '..."
links.text: The voice again, more urgent now: 'Nay!'

links.title: Inland Empire: "Just a moment. That voice isn't hum..."
links.text: Just a moment. That voice isn't human, and it's not saying 'Nay!' -- It's saying 'N-n-n-neigh!'

links.title: Shivers: "From behind you, a low, spectral vo..."
links.text: From behind you, a low, spectral voice whispers: 'Nay.'

links.title: You: "Turn to face the apartments."
links.text: Turn to face the apartments.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Beyond the unkempt backyard rises a..."
links.text: Beyond the unkempt backyard rises a monstrous assemblage of concrete, plaster, and corrugated sheet metal...

links.title: You: "Turn to face the roundabout."
links.text: Turn to face the roundabout.

links.title: Conceptualization: "You turn around. The morning sun is..."
links.text: You turn around. The morning sun is blinding. You bring your hand to your brow and a great shadow materialises before you. A towering beast, frozen in mid-air...

links.title: You: ""The horseback monument.""
links.text: "The horseback monument."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Come on, that's..." She was about..."
links.text: "Come on, that's..." She was about to dismiss your latest idea out of hand, but something gives her pause.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""... not the worst idea...""
links.text: "... not the worst idea..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""The dead king and his horse. It co..."
links.text: "The dead king and his horse. It could work..."

links.title: Inland Empire: "It may work, you think, but why do..."
links.text: It may work, you think, but why do you feel like there may be a terrible cost?

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""We'll need an adequate power suppl..."
links.text: "We'll need an adequate power supply, and a great quantity of cable. If we connect the cables to some of the stranded lorries, we could theoretically increase the antenna's wavelength *exponentially*..."

links.title: Interfacing: "Whatever ambivalence she had about..."
links.text: Whatever ambivalence she had about your project before, she's now fully engaged in solving this technical puzzle.

links.title: You: ""So you're saying...""
links.text: "So you're saying..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Quiet, I'm doing maths... Yes, ass..."
links.text: "Quiet, I'm doing maths... Yes, assuming we can find just a few pieces of equipment..."

links.title: You: "Let her think."
links.text: Let her think.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It's completely ridiculous, but I..."
links.text: "It's completely ridiculous, but I believe we could transform the entire roundabout into one solid, *fractal antenna*."

links.title: Conceptualization: "A note of awe in her voice. She's s..."
links.text: A note of awe in her voice. She's shocked and pleased by her own audacity...

links.title: You: ""About time, those other antennas w..."
links.text: "About time, those other antennas were cramping my style."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Your sense of style isn't my conce..."
links.text: "Your sense of style isn't my concern. I'm only here to tell you what's feasible or not from a technical viewpoint."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I have plenty of cables and amplif..."
links.text: "I have plenty of cables and amplifiers on hand. The power supply I will secure on my own. All we require now is the radio transceiver itself."

links.title: You: ""Where am I supposed to find a radi..."
links.text: "Where am I supposed to find a radio transceiver?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I cannot answer that for you, but..."
links.text: "I cannot answer that for you, but I don't expect it to be *that* difficult. There's no shortage of radios around here."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""If you have reál to spare, you mig..."
links.text: "If you have reál to spare, you might even be able to *buy* one. But it doesn't really matter where it comes from, so long as it works."

links.title: You: ""A radio transceiver. Cool. I've go..."
links.text: "A radio transceiver. Cool. I've got this. I've seen *plenty* of those lying around."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Of course you have. They aren't ex..."
links.text: "Of course you have. They aren't exactly rare."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And before you ask: No, you can't..."
links.text: "And before you ask: No, you can't have the radio from my Kineema."

links.title: You: ""You know what, Kim? I'll find an e..."
links.text: "You know what, Kim? I'll find an even *better* radio on my own."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I highly doubt that. When I crank..."
links.text: "I highly doubt that. When I crank the volume on my DynaWave, it's like you're in the front row at the National Concert Hall."

links.title: You: ""I didn't know *Speedfreaks FM* had..."
links.text: "I didn't know *Speedfreaks FM* had a concert series."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Joke all you want, detective. What..."
links.text: "Joke all you want, detective. Whatever radio you manage to scrounge up won't lay a *finger* on my set-up."

links.title: You: ""Alright, Kim, challenge accepted.""
links.text: "Alright, Kim, challenge accepted."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""There is no need to go out of your..."
links.text: "There is no need to go out of your way to find a *top-shelf* radio for this purpose. As long as it's functional, that is what counts."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Wasn't there a *highly functional*..."
links.text: Wasn't there a *highly functional* radio in that abandoned lorry by the roundabout?

links.title: You: ""On second thought, this is childis..."
links.text: "On second thought, this is childish. I'm just going to look for a regular radio."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""That will be fine. As long as the..."
links.text: "That will be fine. As long as the radio is *functional*, that is what counts."

links.title: You: ""Can't we just use your radiocomput..."
links.text: "Can't we just use your radiocomputer?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Absolutely not. My Rehm Prefect is..."
links.text: "Absolutely not. My Rehm Prefect is my livelihood. If something were to go wrong, it would be a disaster."

links.title: You: ""Do radiocomputers have transceiver..."
links.text: "Do radiocomputers have transceivers in them?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Certainly, though it requires a fa..."
links.text: "Certainly, though it requires a fair amount of technical finesse to remove them. Frankly, it's not worth the bother. Just find a regular radio."

links.title: You: ""I think I saw a radio in that offi..."
links.text: "I think I saw a radio in that office near the harbour..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""That sounds like a perfectly adequ..."
links.text: "That sounds like a perfectly adequate radio." She nods.

links.title: You: ""Do you think the pawnshop will hav..."
links.text: "Do you think the pawnshop will have one?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Possibly. It's worth a look, at th..."
links.text: "Possibly. It's worth a look, at the least."

links.title: You: ""Alright, I guess I need to find on..."
links.text: "Alright, I guess I need to find one of these transceivers then." (Conclude.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""In the meantime, I will gather the..."
links.text: "In the meantime, I will gather the rest of the materials. We will meet back here when you have it."

links.title: You: ""We shall call it: The Herald of De..."
links.text: "We shall call it: The Herald of Destruction."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""What you choose to call it isn't m..."
links.text: "What you choose to call it isn't my concern. I'm only here to tell you what's feasible or not from a technical viewpoint."

links.title: You: ""As long as it gets the job done, I..."
links.text: "As long as it gets the job done, I'm not interested in the details."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Very well. I will get straight to..."
links.text: "Very well. I will get straight to the point, then." She nods, seeming to appreciate your cold practicality.

links.title: You: ""Are you sure that's legal? I feel..."
links.text: "Are you sure that's legal? I feel like I'm going to need to apologise to someone."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""If you would like to apologise, th..."
links.text: "If you would like to apologise, that is your business. I am only here to tell you what's feasible or not from a technical viewpoint."

links.title: You: ""That's... a very big antenna.""
links.text: "That's... a very big antenna."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes, very likely the largest priva..."
links.text: "Yes, very likely the largest private antenna in Revachol."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Nope, nothing. The idea factory is..."
links.text: Nope, nothing. The idea factory is closed until further notice.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "The programmer gives you an impatie..."
links.text: The programmer gives you an impatient look before returning to her radiocomputer.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Your thinking about this has gotten..."
links.text: Your thinking about this has gotten way too rigid. Time to flip the whole *antenna paradigm* on its head.

links.title: You: ""Hear me out: What if we built the..."
links.text: "Hear me out: What if we built the antenna *underground*?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Then it would be very difficult to..."
links.text: "Then it would be very difficult to propagate the signal through the air... which would defeat the purpose."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Detective, does the 41st not requi..."
links.text: "Detective, does the 41st not require its officers to pass Elementary Radio Operations? I thought it was an RCM-wide policy."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""To be perfectly frank, I'm not sur..."
links.text: "To be perfectly frank, I'm not sure your ideas are really helping."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Alright, brainstorming time. Rememb..."
links.text: Alright, brainstorming time. Remember, this is just the ideation phase. There are no *bad* ideas.

links.title: You: ""I've got it. Why don't we use the..."
links.text: "I've got it. Why don't we use the mast of a giant *boat*?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Do you have access to a giant boat?""
links.text: "Do you have access to a giant boat?"

links.title: You: ""I could ask the representative fro..."
links.text: "I could ask the representative from the Wild Pines. She's a friend of mine."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Something tells me Ms. Messier wou..."
links.text: "Something tells me Ms. Messier would be *less than thrilled* to hear you plan to commandeer her boat so you can talk to a Coalition warship."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes, it is not a very likely scena..."
links.text: "Yes, it is not a very likely scenario."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I very much doubt anyone from the..."
links.text: "I very much doubt anyone from the Wild Pines would allow us to turn their boat into a giant radio transmitter."

links.title: You: ""No.""
links.text: "No."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""That is why we don't use it, then.""
links.text: "That is why we don't use it, then."

links.title: You: ""Here's an idea: Maybe there's an a..."
links.text: "Here's an idea: Maybe there's an antenna in the harbour we could use?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Don't you think the Union would ob..."
links.text: "Don't you think the Union would object to that?"

links.title: You: ""No way, me and Evrart are tight.""
links.text: "No way, me and Evrart are tight."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Problematically so, one might even..."
links.text: "Problematically so, one might even argue."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I don't know about your relationsh..."
links.text: "I don't know about your relationship to the Union, but I do not think they would appreciate us using their equipment to contact the Coalition."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I do not think that the boss of th..."
links.text: "I do not think that the boss of the Union would like us using his equipment to contact the Coalition."

links.title: You: ""Hmmm, maybe.""
links.text: "Hmmm, maybe."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""That is why we don't use it, then.""
links.text: "That is why we don't use it, then."

links.title: Conceptualization: "That's easy! Antennas are basically..."
links.text: That's easy! Antennas are basically just tall things, right?

links.title: You: ""We could use the steeple of *this*..."
links.text: "We could use the steeple of *this* church." (Point up.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No, we could not. This church is m..."
links.text: "No, we could not. This church is made from wood. I am not sure you understand how radios work."

links.title: You: ""I'm ready now. Let's contact Arche..."
links.text: "I'm ready now. Let's contact Archer."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Very good. If you'll help me with..."
links.text: "Very good. If you'll help me with some of this equipment, then..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Back across the waterlock. At leas..."
links.text: "Back across the waterlock. At least we're getting our *exercise* in today."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""If you'll please carry that amplif..."
links.text: "If you'll please carry that amplifier and cables, officer. We have quite a lot to carry..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""If you'll please carry that amplif..."
links.text: "If you'll please carry that amplifier and cables, officer. We have quite a lot to carry..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Can you please just go and move th..."
links.text: "Can you please just go and move the water bowls for me? Thanks."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Great -- after we've done this, we..."
links.text: "Great -- after we've done this, we can finally get to the island," the lieutenant says, satisfied.

links.title: Volition: "Great -- after you've done this, yo..."
links.text: Great -- after you've done this, you can finally get to the island. Let's wrap this up!

links.title: You: ""I found a radio transceiver.""
links.text: "I found a radio transceiver."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Ah, very good. Let's see what you..."
links.text: "Ah, very good. Let's see what you have."

links.title: You: ""I got this beauty down at the pawn..."
links.text: "I got this beauty down at the pawnshop." (Use the highly expensive transceiver.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Is this... a Kristallsprach?" She..."
links.text: "Is this... a Kristallsprach?" She looks up at you as she gently opens the case. "The Model 9 is an excellent piece of equipment. I don't know what you had to pay for it, but it should work very nicely."

links.title: Interfacing: "It's not often that she allows hers..."
links.text: It's not often that she allows herself to be awed, but the way she holds the Kristallsprach reminds you of someone receiving a precious gift.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I believe that means we're ready t..."
links.text: "I believe that means we're ready to get started. I should warn you, once we begin setting up this antenna, we'll need to see the whole process through. There won't be any second chances, any 'do-overs,' you understand?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""So if there's anything you'd like..."
links.text: "So if there's anything you'd like to get in order before we depart, I suggest you do it now."

links.title: You: ""Wait, didn't you say we need some..."
links.text: "Wait, didn't you say we need some kind of power supply?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Ah, yes. I wasn't sure what to do..."
links.text: "Ah, yes. I wasn't sure what to do about that, but then I discovered an abandoned power source down by the edge of the bay."

links.title: Logic: "It's obvious she's referring to you..."
links.text: It's obvious she's referring to your half-sunken Coupris 40.

links.title: You: ""You mean the motor carriage that I..."
links.text: "You mean the motor carriage that I crashed into the bay?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Ah. Yes, I did notice that it was..."
links.text: "Ah. Yes, I did notice that it was covered in police livery. Then you already know that the carriage itself is irreparable, but the rear-mounted engine seems to be in fine working order..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""My intention is to run a power cab..."
links.text: "My intention is to run a power cable from the engine up to the antenna. It won't last forever, but it should give us enough time to establish a connection with Coalition Warship Archer."

links.title: You: ""What do you mean an *abandoned* po..."
links.text: "What do you mean an *abandoned* power source?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Someone, I don't know how, appears..."
links.text: "Someone, I don't know how, appears to have driven a perfectly good Coupris motor carriage into the bay. The carriage itself is a loss, but the rear-mounted engine is still perfectly functional..."

links.title: Interfacing: "You really should look into this to..."
links.text: You really should look into this totalled MC when you have a chance. Seems important...

links.title: You: ""Ah, well as long as it works, I do..."
links.text: "Ah, well as long as it works, I don't need to know the details."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""In that case, let's move on.""
links.text: "In that case, let's move on."

links.title: Logic: "An 'abandoned power source'? What c..."
links.text: An 'abandoned power source'? What could she be referring to?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Whatever it is, it was abandoned fo..."
links.text: Whatever it is, it was abandoned for *good* reason. Best to leave some stones unturned...

links.title: You: ""What kind of stuff should I 'get i..."
links.text: "What kind of stuff should I 'get in order'?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""That's up to you. At a minimum, I..."
links.text: "That's up to you. At a minimum, I would make sure you are physically *and* mentally prepared for an intense and difficult process. Once we begin, there can be no interruptions."

links.title: Interfacing: "At the very least, you should make..."
links.text: At the very least, you should make sure you're wearing a good pair of gloves.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Radio-engineers typically carry ov..."
links.text: "Radio-engineers typically carry over-priced solvent sprays to clean the antenna connections, but in a pinch some common ammonia works just fine..."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Pssst, it's the alcohol *in* the am..."
links.text: Pssst, it's the alcohol *in* the ammonia doing the real work, kinda like with you.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Finally, there's the question of *..."
links.text: "Finally, there's the question of *stimulants*. Some people prefer to keep illegal amphetamines on-hand to help with their work. I am not one of them, but they do exist."

links.title: You: ""Isn't it a little ironic that you'..."
links.text: "Isn't it a little ironic that you're recommending amphetamines after what happened with the speedfreaks?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I'm not interested in irony. I lea..."
links.text: "I'm not interested in irony. I leave that to more *conceptual* types."

links.title: You: ""I try to avoid drugs. Abusing stim..."
links.text: "I try to avoid drugs. Abusing stimulants is *highly* irresponsible."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I don't take them because they mak..."
links.text: "I don't take them because they make me nauseous, but everyone has their reasons. I don't judge."

links.title: You: ""So this isn't the first time you'v..."
links.text: "So this isn't the first time you've hung around speedfreaks, is it?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It is possible that technical fiel..."
links.text: "It is possible that technical fields attract a certain kind of personality. I haven't given it much thought."

links.title: You: ""I'm ready. Let's do this.""
links.text: "I'm ready. Let's do this."

links.title: You: ""Hang on, I need some time to prepa..."
links.text: "Hang on, I need some time to prepare."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""That's fine. Return to me when you..."
links.text: "That's fine. Return to me when you are ready to go."

links.title: You: ""Someone was using this to coordina..."
links.text: "Someone was using this to coordinate a drug smuggling operation." (Use the highly advanced transceiver.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Interesting," she says as examines..."
links.text: "Interesting," she says as examines the transceiver, "an Esterhaz EH-4, heavily customised. This is an advanced model, highly capable. I'll need to replace the frequency dial, but it should certainly work for our purposes."

links.title: Interfacing: "She's impressed by your resourceful..."
links.text: She's impressed by your resourcefulness as much as by the equipment itself.

links.title: You: ""I found this in an office by the h..."
links.text: "I found this in an office by the harbour." (Use the perfectly adequate transceiver.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Not the most advanced model." She..."
links.text: "Not the most advanced model." She turns a few dials and then sets the transceiver aside. "But at least everything appears to be in order. Yes, this should serve our purposes."

links.title: Interfacing: "No further comment necessary."
links.text: No further comment necessary.

links.title: You: ""The radio relay tower is in bad sh..."
links.text: "The radio relay tower is in bad shape. I don't think we can use it to reach the Archer."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""That is not good. In case you have..."
links.text: "That is not good. In case you have not noticed, Martinaise is not exactly a hub for high-powered radio antennas..."

links.title: Logic: "She has an idea, though. You can se..."
links.text: She has an idea, though. You can see the tiny signal lights firing inside her brain...

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I don't see any alternative. We're..."
links.text: "I don't see any alternative. We're just going to have to build the antenna ourselves."

links.title: You: ""Why don't we just use your AR-1?""
links.text: "Why don't we just use your AR-1?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Because it's a completely differen..."
links.text: "Because it's a completely different class of antenna. It would be like using a high-end racing carriage where a long-distance lorry is required."

links.title: You: ""Wait, we can just *build* an anten..."
links.text: "Wait, we can just *build* an antenna?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes. From a technical view, it's n..."
links.text: "Yes. From a technical view, it's not even difficult. The difficult part will be finding the *right* location."

links.title: You: ""That sounds hard. Can't we just ge..."
links.text: "That sounds hard. Can't we just get one from someplace else?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Not the sort of antenna we require..."
links.text: "Not the sort of antenna we require. The Coalition has a near-monopoly on mega-low-frequency radio equipment. Fortunately, they do not have a monopoly on physics."

links.title: You: ""Now we're talking! What do we have..."
links.text: "Now we're talking! What do we have to do?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""We need metal. A lot of it. The ta..."
links.text: "We need metal. A lot of it. The taller the structure, the better. Something that is both prominent and easily accessible. If it's near a power source, even better."

links.title: You: ""I do have one mystery that still n..."
links.text: "I do have one mystery that still needs solving... the radio ghost in the Doomed Commercial Area's electronic doorbell."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""The creepy woman!" She slaps her f..."
links.text: "The creepy woman!" She slaps her forehead. "We were wondering about that when we worked there... but I had completely forgotten about it ever since!"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It must be entroponetic crosstalk...."
links.text: "It must be entroponetic crosstalk. The one you get in radios and long-distance calls... Now it makes sense, with the pale right on the doorstep."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Incredible..." the lieutenant murm..."
links.text: "Incredible..." the lieutenant murmurs. "This would also explain why we get it on the police radio all the time."

links.title: You: ""Entroponetic crosstalk?""
links.text: "Entroponetic crosstalk?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It's quite common actually. When t..."
links.text: "It's quite common actually. When the signal gets routed through pale, all kinds of irregularities take place. You may hear snippets of someone else's conversation, or the voice of your former lover, or an echo of an event that took place 100 years ago."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Pale is a shroud of memories and i..."
links.text: "Pale is a shroud of memories and it doesn't really distinguish to whom those memories belong to. You could hear anything."

links.title: You: ""That makes sense. Thanks for expla..."
links.text: "That makes sense. Thanks for explaining that to me."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Anytime." She smiles."
links.text: "Anytime." She smiles.

links.title: You: ""Alright, I talked to Egg Head, he..."
links.text: "Alright, I talked to Egg Head, he plugged in the cable. You can now *unmute* your speakers."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Okay, but..." She seems hesitant,..."
links.text: "Okay, but..." She seems hesitant, her eyes still fixed on Egg Head. "Think you can ask him to turn the volume down a bit, just in case?"

links.title: Egg Head: ""MAXIMUM!" shouts Egg Head, a great..."
links.text: "MAXIMUM!" shouts Egg Head, a great smile still adorning his face, larger than a red dwarf star.

links.title: Egg Head: ""MAXIMUM IS THE ONLY WAY!""
links.text: "MAXIMUM IS THE ONLY WAY!"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I know, I know it is, but... could..."
links.text: "I know, I know it is, but... could you *please* turn it down just this instance? Just *this* one time -- maximum is *not* the only way, okay?"

links.title: Egg Head: ""Pump it to the brick, pump it to t..."
links.text: "Pump it to the brick, pump it to the hard master! There is no other way. Glue-style."

links.title: Interfacing: "Glue-style? Okay, there *literally*..."
links.text: Glue-style? Okay, there *literally* is no other way. The mixing desk is glued to maximum.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""See?" She turns to face you, ready..."
links.text: "See?" She turns to face you, ready to give up. "He *pumps it to the hard master*. It's hopeless..."

links.title: You: ""Why do you want to turn down the v..."
links.text: "Why do you want to turn down the volume?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Because I'm afraid that something..."
links.text: "Because I'm afraid that something might happen. It's an unknown phenomenon..." She turns to Egg Head. "We can always turn it back up if there's a need."

links.title: Egg Head: ""CAN'T TURN DOWN THE HARD CORE!""
links.text: "CAN'T TURN DOWN THE HARD CORE!"

links.title: You: ""I think what Egg Head is trying to..."
links.text: "I think what Egg Head is trying to say here is that the volume button is *stuck* on maximum."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Of course it is." She shrugs, cons..."
links.text: "Of course it is." She shrugs, consigned to her fate.

links.title: Egg Head: ""YEAGHHH! PERMANENT ENLIGHTENMENT...."
links.text: "YEAGHHH! PERMANENT ENLIGHTENMENT. RAY OF SOUND."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Never mind then, let's get on with..."
links.text: "Never mind then, let's get on with our project... I am going to unmute the speakers on a count of five. Everyone ready?" She looks around the church.

links.title: Egg Head: "Egg Head pumps his hand up in the a..."
links.text: Egg Head pumps his hand up in the air, waiting for the beat to drop.

links.title: Andre: ""Born ready," says Andre."
links.text: "Born ready," says Andre.

links.title: Noid: ""Ready!" yells Noid."
links.text: "Ready!" yells Noid.

links.title: Acele: ""I'm ready if you two are, detectiv..."
links.text: "I'm ready if you two are, detectives."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant nods stoically."
links.text: The lieutenant nods stoically.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Not so stoically -- his hand moves..."
links.text: Not so stoically -- his hand moves to the gun holster.

links.title: Acele: ""I'm ready if you are, detective.""
links.text: "I'm ready if you are, detective."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Suddenly your palms are sweaty. The..."
links.text: Suddenly your palms are sweaty. The church seems cold and large, somehow...

links.title: Half Light: "There's tightness in your chest; an..."
links.text: There's tightness in your chest; anxiety.

links.title: You: ""Uh, hold on for a moment...""
links.text: "Uh, hold on for a moment..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""What?""
links.text: "What?"

links.title: You: ""Maybe we shouldn't do this. It's t..."
links.text: "Maybe we shouldn't do this. It's too dangerous. On maximum volume too..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No, we should definitely do this...."
links.text: "No, we should definitely do this. I *am* going to do this. Ready?" She pauses, looking around the church -- everyone stares at her hand on the keyboard.

links.title: Composure: "Her hand is trembling slightly..."
links.text: Her hand is trembling slightly...

links.title: You: ""Never mind, let's do this. I'm rea..."
links.text: "Never mind, let's do this. I'm ready. Whooh..." (Proceed.)

links.title: You: ""Okay. Ready." (Proceed.)"
links.text: "Okay. Ready." (Proceed.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Five...""
links.text: "Five..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Four...""
links.text: "Four..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Three...""
links.text: "Three..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Two...""
Soona, the Programmer: ""One...""
Soona, the Programmer: ""Mute disengaged." She lifts her ha..."
links.text: "Mute disengaged." She lifts her hand from the keyboard. Complete silence fills the room.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "No wind outside. No waves. No floor..."
links.text: No wind outside. No waves. No floorboards creaking. Total, continuous silence. This is... unnatural.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "The woman looks around. In the sile..."
links.text: The woman looks around. In the silence, you see dust move on the floorboards. The driver of the speaker vibrates in the air and then stops. Plasterwork begins to crumble down the walls...

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "In the silence, a low hum starts cr..."
links.text: In the silence, a low hum starts creeping up your spine. It's a song inside you -- not in the speakers, not in the room. A great bass sigh in the basement of your mind. Slowly it builds, until the air around you starts to vibrate.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "It's out there now. In the world. M..."
links.text: It's out there now. In the world. Made manifest.

links.title: Half Light: "It will devour everything."
links.text: It will devour everything.

links.title: Inland Empire: "The floorboards. The glass. The str..."
links.text: The floorboards. The glass. The streets and the people. Nothing will remain.

links.title: Andre: ""Guys, what's going on?" There's al..."
links.text: "Guys, what's going on?" There's alarm in the man's voice, as he steps back to scan the surroundings. A slight rattle like crystal clattering in the cupboard fills the air, joining the chorus.

links.title: Interfacing: "This fragile world is about to brea..."
links.text: This fragile world is about to break.

links.title: Noid: ""It's getting louder..." says Noid,..."
links.text: "It's getting louder..." says Noid, his eyes riveted on the strange circle of water basins.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "In the basins -- the water looks li..."
links.text: In the basins -- the water looks like it's *boiling*.

links.title: Egg Head: ""HOSIANNAH! MOTHER OF MEGA!" You he..."
links.text: "HOSIANNAH! MOTHER OF MEGA!" You hear Egg Head yell -- then something else, but his voice is growing faint...

links.title: Empathy: "In his mind, a tidal wave approachi..."
links.text: In his mind, a tidal wave approaching from afar, swallowing entire coastlines on its way... salvation.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "He's peaking -- the worst high he's..."
links.text: He's peaking -- the worst high he's ever been on.

links.title: You: ""Hey, uh, what's that weird rattlin..."
links.text: "Hey, uh, what's that weird rattling sound...?"

links.title: Egg Head: ""The BEAUTY AND THE BEAT! The futur..."
links.text: "The BEAUTY AND THE BEAT! The future of dance, PLANETARY!"

links.title: Acele: ""No, Egg! It's the window." The gla..."
links.text: "No, Egg! It's the window." The glass shards around Dolores Dei's vacant heart appear to be vibrating from the sound. It almost looks as if she's alive.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "In the corner of your eye, the lieu..."
links.text: In the corner of your eye, the lieutenant steps aside cautiously, his eyes searching for a possible evacuation route.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""The window is going to come down...."
links.text: "The window is going to come down. NO, THE ROOF..." She looks up. A screech fills the air, a scream of wood and nails -- the pillars of the church twist and creak above and around you.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Cracks appear on the stained glass..."
links.text: Cracks appear on the stained glass window. Cracks run up the wooden pillars in the dark...

links.title: Egg Head: ""COME DOWN TO US! LOVE!""
links.text: "COME DOWN TO US! LOVE!"

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Below it all the bass grows, like t..."
links.text: Below it all the bass grows, like the jaws of a giant compressor gnawing on metal and wood. It does not sound benevolent *at all*.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "It's shaking the building's foundat..."
links.text: It's shaking the building's foundation. The floor twists...

links.title: Composure: "A great PULSE arises in your flesh...."
links.text: A great PULSE arises in your flesh...

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""That's it, I'm muting it!" She rea..."
links.text: "That's it, I'm muting it!" She reaches for the keyboard...

links.title: You: ""OH, I WANT TO DANCE WITH SOMEBODY!..."
links.text: "OH, I WANT TO DANCE WITH SOMEBODY!" (Start tapping your foot.)

links.title: Egg Head: ""OH, I WANT TO FEEL THE HEAT WITH S..."
links.text: "OH, I WANT TO FEEL THE HEAT WITH SOMEBODY!"

links.title: You: ""Yeah, we should stop. Soona, mute..."
links.text: "Yeah, we should stop. Soona, mute it!"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Shit, it doesn't stop!" The woman..."
links.text: "Shit, it doesn't stop!" The woman is furiously pressing down on her keyboard -- but the sound doesn't stop. "Acele, have you...?"

links.title: Acele: ""Yes, I've turned it off!" She yell..."
links.text: "Yes, I've turned it off!" She yells, holding the contact mic in her hand.

links.title: Shivers: "THE MIC IS NOTHING. THIS HAS NOTHIN..."
links.text: THE MIC IS NOTHING. THIS HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH THE MIC.

links.title: Acele: ""Andre, pull the compressor! The pl..."
links.text: "Andre, pull the compressor! The place is gonna come down..."

links.title: Andre: ""Fuck..." Andre frantically smashes..."
links.text: "Fuck..." Andre frantically smashes buttons. "I can't shut it up, the signal's passed... It's not *in* here! It's..."

links.title: Logic: "In the mixing desk now. Building in..."
links.text: In the mixing desk now. Building into a positive feedback loop.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "THIS IS IT. A great roar, the vault..."
links.text: THIS IS IT. A great roar, the vault of the roof twists above you, glass shatters somewhere near the door... it's coming down.

links.title: You: ""Egg Head! It's in the desk!""
links.text: "Egg Head! It's in the desk!"

links.title: Egg Head: "And then it stops. Totally and utte..."
links.text: And then it stops. Totally and utterly -- as if there never was a sound. Only your ears still ring from the shock. Everybody is staring at Egg Head -- holding a dangling cable in his hand. A black three-pin connector.

links.title: Acele: ""Egg...""
Egg Head: ""I pulled the plug," he says, calml..."
links.text: "I pulled the plug," he says, calmly. "It was getting *too* hard core."

links.title: Andre: ""You did good, Egg..." Andre breath..."
links.text: "You did good, Egg..." Andre breathes a sigh of relief and inspects the window.  "Most of the place seems to be intact. Fucking L... Programmer-lady, tell me you were recording that!"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Four years..." the woman whispers...."
links.text: "Four years..." the woman whispers. "Twenty two people, millions of reáls... All that time *this* is what we were up against? Just erased it..." Her lip trembles. "Sulisław isn't gonna believe this."

links.title: Andre: ""Yeah, but did you record it though..."
links.text: "Yeah, but did you record it though? It was dope, I think we can use it."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes, Andre." She composes herself..."
links.text: "Yes, Andre." She composes herself -- wipes the dust off her sweater and rests her hands on the keyboard. "I recorded it. Damn, I need to send some letters now..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Thank you all for doing this. Egg..."
links.text: "Thank you all for doing this. Egg Man, you too. And you, officer." She turns to you. "I don't know *what* we've discovered, but I know what it sounds like now. That's a start."

links.title: You: ""Kim, did *you* hear that?""
links.text: "Kim, did *you* hear that?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It was *very* hard not to. I think..."
links.text: "It was *very* hard not to. I think you're right," he turns to the woman. "There *is* something going on here -- and you need to be *very* careful with it."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I promise, officer. We will *not*..."
links.text: "I promise, officer. We will *not* play it again."

links.title: You: ""What *was* that? I've never heard..."
links.text: "What *was* that? I've never heard anything like that."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It was mathematical information --..."
links.text: "It was mathematical information -- from the anomaly -- presented as a waveform. That's what it was *technically* -- theoretically..." She shakes her head.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I have no idea. I've never even he..."
links.text: "I have no idea. I've never even heard of anything like this."

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Her voice seems muffled in the sile..."
links.text: Her voice seems muffled in the silent church. It's your ears adjusting after the exposure.

links.title: You: ""You're going to write Sulisław?""
links.text: "You're going to write Sulisław?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes. Our lead designer. And maybe..."
links.text: "Yes. Our lead designer. And maybe some of the producers too. And some of the writers, if they're sober enough to open a transmission. They need to hear..."

links.title: Empathy: "That it wasn't her fault. Or theirs..."
links.text: That it wasn't her fault. Or theirs.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""They need to hear about this. Don'..."
links.text: "They need to hear about this. Don't worry, I won't send the recording -- although I doubt they have the speakers to produce the frequency anyway..."

links.title: You: ""What happens now. Are you going to..."
links.text: "What happens now. Are you going to..." (Conclude.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Stay here," she cuts you off, her..."
links.text: "Stay here," she cuts you off, her deft fingers already on the keyboard. "I am going to stay here with these lunatics, send letters, maybe meet Sulisław... Also devise further measurements."

links.title: Andre: ""I want you to know that's totally..."
links.text: "I want you to know that's totally chill with us."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I don't care," she blurts, then re..."
links.text: "I don't care," she blurts, then reconsiders: "But thank you anyway."

links.title: Volition: "That's the best she can manage for..."
links.text: That's the best she can manage for Andre. It's quite a lot, in truth. For her, at least.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Now..." Her hands move on the keyb..."
links.text: "Now..." Her hands move on the keyboard. "I have a theory to come up with. *Some* kind of preliminary explanation to all this, or the letter will sound like I've lost my mind..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes. And we have to get back to st..."
links.text: "Yes. And we have to get back to stabilizing Martinaise..." He breathes out, trying to shake off tension. "Instead of demolishing it with loud bass noise of unknown origins."

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Some tiny hard thing lets go in you..."
links.text: Some tiny hard thing lets go in your stomach. You're still alive.

links.title: Inland Empire: "You have an explanation for all thi..."
links.text: You have an explanation for all this. Somewhere deep in you -- you *know*. The person you *were* knows.

links.title: Inland Empire: "You *have* an explanation for all t..."
links.text: You *have* an explanation for all this. Somewhere deep in you -- you just don't have the pieces yet.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "You don't know enough about the wor..."
links.text: You don't know enough about the world. But that *Joyce* -- if you knew all she knows, could put it together...

links.title: Egg Head: "And then it stops. Totally and utte..."
links.text: And then it stops. Totally and utterly -- as if there never was a sound. Only your ears still ring from the shock. Everybody is staring at Egg Head -- holding a dangling cable in his hand. A black three-pin connector.

links.title: You: ""Egg Head?! Can you stop it?""
links.text: "Egg Head?! Can you stop it?"

links.title: You: ""Egg Head -- whatever you do, don't..."
links.text: "Egg Head -- whatever you do, don't stop it!"

links.title: Egg Head: "But then it stops. Totally and utte..."
links.text: But then it stops. Totally and utterly -- as if there never was a sound. Only your ears still ring from the shock. Everybody is staring at Egg Head -- holding a dangling cable in his hand. A black three-pin connector.

links.title: Egg Head: "But then it stops. Totally and utte..."
links.text: But then it stops. Totally and utterly -- as if there never was a sound. Only your ears still ring from the shock. Everybody is staring at Egg Head -- holding a dangling cable in his hand. A black three-pin connector.

links.title: You: ""Everybody, don't panic, it's beaut..."
links.text: "Everybody, don't panic, it's beautiful!"

links.title: Egg Head: ""BEAUTIFUL CORE, BEAUTIFUL LIFE!""
links.text: "BEAUTIFUL CORE, BEAUTIFUL LIFE!"

links.title: You: ""It was... it was *in* me at first...."
links.text: "It was... it was *in* me at first..."

links.title: You: ""I've never heard anything this har..."
links.text: "I've never heard anything this hard core in my life!"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "In the silence, a low hum starts cr..."
links.text: In the silence, a low hum starts creeping up your spine. It's a song inside you -- not in the speakers, not in the room. A great bass sigh in the basement of your mind. Slowly it builds, until the air around you starts to vibrate.

links.title: You: "Form a theory on the two-millimetre..."
links.text: Form a theory on the two-millimetre hole in the world.

links.title: Logic: "You don't have to. You already *hav..."
links.text: You don't have to. You already *have*. A long time ago.

links.title: You: "Wait... *how*?"
links.text: Wait... *how*?

links.title: Logic: "These thoughts formed in you somewh..."
links.text: These thoughts formed in you somewhere, in a long forgotten discussion. Behind a kitchen table, in the evening light.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Drinking coffee and smoking. With a..."
links.text: Drinking coffee and smoking. With a friend.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "And a woman, she was there too. Her..."
links.text: And a woman, she was there too. Her hair smelled of shampoo and she was smoking.

links.title: You: ""Soona, it is the origin point of t..."
links.text: "Soona, it is the origin point of the pale."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""What?""
links.text: "What?"

links.title: You: ""The swallow -- it's how it starts...."
links.text: "The swallow -- it's how it starts. It's baby pale."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""But..." She looks up, and there's..."
links.text: "But..." She looks up, and there's fear in her eyes as she considers the possibility. "But pale isn't here. We're thousands of kilometres from the edge."

links.title: Half Light: "That comforts her."
links.text: That comforts her.

links.title: You: ""No." (Look up first.) "We are twen..."
links.text: "No." (Look up first.) "We are twenty metres from the *very* edge."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She looks up into the darkness unde..."
links.text: She looks up into the darkness under the nave, then back at you.

links.title: Rhetoric: "You have her full, undivided attent..."
links.text: You have her full, undivided attention.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant's too. He takes his..."
links.text: The lieutenant's too. He takes his glasses off.

links.title: You: ""The pale is only an effect. A tran..."
links.text: "The pale is only an effect. A transition between the world -- and *that*."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Then... what *is* that?""
links.text: "Then... what *is* that?"

links.title: Logic: "It's nothing. No... it's *less* tha..."
links.text: It's nothing. No... it's *less* than nothing. No...

links.title: You: ""It's *less than less than nothing*..."
links.text: "It's *less than less than nothing*. The final rest state for reality. Imagine if all this..." (Spread your hands.) "*Never was.*"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Then the pale is...""
links.text: "Then the pale is..."

links.title: You: ""Simply a gradient.""
links.text: "Simply a gradient."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""But the gradient -- it clearly has..."
links.text: "But the gradient -- it clearly hasn't started yet. We're here and the pale is not."

links.title: You: ""One day, when it's larger, it will..."
links.text: "One day, when it's larger, it will be."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I understand..." She closes her ey..."
links.text: "I understand..." She closes her eyes. "A theory of the pale where instead of an *outer ocean* it metastasises -- like a cancer or a mould -- erupting in points *inside* the world."

links.title: You: "(Nod.) "*This* is one of those plac..."
links.text: (Nod.) "*This* is one of those places."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She's silent for a second. Then she..."
links.text: She's silent for a second. Then she opens her mouth. "According to this -- how long..."

links.title: You: ""...until it starts *swallowing*? I..."
links.text: "...until it starts *swallowing*? It's already started. Starting with sound."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""And information," she nods. "Causi..."
links.text: "And information," she nods. "Causing data losses in the East-Insulindian front. Have you considered why it's formed in a church? And, also, *when* or *how* it might start growing? Or -- if it has other effects? In addition to sound and data..."

links.title: Empathy: "An intellectual hunger fills her no..."
links.text: An intellectual hunger fills her now, casting fear aside.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I also have a question -- since we..."
links.text: "I also have a question -- since we're piling them on. How do *you* know this? I'm not doubting you," he explains, "I'm simply curious as to how a detective of the RCM..."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "... knows how to think this?"
links.text: ... knows how to think this?

links.title: You: ""It didn't form in a church, the ch..."
links.text: "It didn't form in a church, the church formed around it."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Of course! A pinewood sarcophagus,..."
links.text: "Of course! A pinewood sarcophagus, or a..." She looks for words. "A containment facility of some kind, built by the first settlers."

links.title: You: ""Yes. Acting on an instinctual leve..."
links.text: "Yes. Acting on an instinctual level. Or religious practices we've forgotten."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I have considered the same. The ba..."
links.text: "I have considered the same. The bad news is -- there were *seven* pinewood churches built in the first decade of Revachol's settlement."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Most of them were burnt down durin..."
links.text: "Most of them were burnt down during the Revolution, or re-purposed before, during the Suzerain. I'm not saying *all* of them have one in them, but.."

links.title: Half Light: "Some of them might. A black grain,..."
links.text: Some of them might. A black grain, hanging in the air...

links.title: You: ""*Or* it can be a coincidence.""
links.text: "*Or* it can be a coincidence."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes. But still -- I have considere..."
links.text: "Yes. But still -- I have considered the same. And the bad news is -- there were *seven* such pinewood churches built in the first decade of Revachol's settlement."

links.title: You: ""All the failed businesses in the D..."
links.text: "All the failed businesses in the Doomed Commercial Area. All the failure in Martinaise..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""You think the presence of that *pu..."
links.text: "You think the presence of that *puncture* has somehow... influenced the outcome of events here? Even, say, software development?"

links.title: Empathy: "She already made up her mind when s..."
links.text: She already made up her mind when she heard it. Some kind of great and uncaring force had to play a part... it wasn't *only* them.

links.title: You: ""Yes. Even the Revolution was defea..."
links.text: "Yes. Even the Revolution was defeated here. I mean a kind of... entroponetic history."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I told the producers we need to go..."
links.text: "I told the producers we need to go and move to a normal office building, with amenities. But no -- the artists like the *milieu*. The writers like the *history*..." She shakes her head. "I told them."

links.title: You: ""I should let people still working..."
links.text: "I should let people still working in there know about this. They might be affected."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""You mean... Plaisance and the dice..."
links.text: "You mean... Plaisance and the dicemaker? There was almost no one left when we packed up."

links.title: You: ""No, just the dicemaker. I don't th..."
links.text: "No, just the dicemaker. I don't think Plaisance would survive this knowledge."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Then go tell her." She smiles broa..."
links.text: "Then go tell her." She smiles broadly.

links.title: You: ""No, just Plaisance. I don't think..."
links.text: "No, just Plaisance. I don't think Neha is playing fair in this game."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Then go tell her." She smiles broa..."
links.text: "Then go tell her." She smiles broadly.

links.title: You: ""Yes, both of them deserve to know.""
links.text: "Yes, both of them deserve to know."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Then go tell them." She smiles, su..."
links.text: "Then go tell them." She smiles, suddenly encouraging.

links.title: You: "No -- It's better they don't know."
links.text: No -- It's better they don't know.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I told them, but no -- normal offi..."
links.text: "I told them, but no -- normal office buildings are *bourgeois*..."

links.title: You: ""All the failed businesses and ideo..."
links.text: "All the failed businesses and ideologies -- there's something *wrong* here."

links.title: You: ""No. We're reaching. People fail on..."
links.text: "No. We're reaching. People fail on their own."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""True, we never should have upgrade..."
links.text: "True, we never should have upgraded to Vox '50. And the spec kept changing. And those damn *Heads*... but still, the anomaly caused a massive data loss. So -- it had a part to play. It does *something*."

links.title: You: ""Tiago -- under the roof -- he said..."
links.text: "Tiago -- under the roof -- he said he's circling the spot, like a saeraff. He seemed to have lost his mind."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""The crab-man... From what I've hea..."
links.text: "The crab-man... From what I've heard, his state could be reminiscent of pale over-exposure. Time-perception related illnesses, memory malfunctions, thought insertion."

links.title: Suggestion: "She's agreeing more and more. Parti..."
links.text: She's agreeing more and more. Partially because she *wants* to.

links.title: Inland Empire: "And then there is you. And what hap..."
links.text: And then there is you. And what happened to *your* mind. Are you not a saeraff in worship too?

links.title: You: ""I think I've had this thought befo..."
links.text: "I think I've had this thought before. That's how I know."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""An amateur-entroponetic police off..."
links.text: "An amateur-entroponetic police officer... I'd like to say I've heard stranger things, but I'm not sure. This is a hell of a guess, however. Well worded I might add..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes, it is *very* interesting, but..."
links.text: "Yes, it is *very* interesting, but I wouldn't say you *know*. This is a guess. One that's going to have to be *proved* -- by entroponetic scientists."

links.title: You: "(Conclude.) "One day all the world..."
links.text: (Conclude.) "One day all the world will be like that two-millimetre hole."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She falls silent. The wind blows in..."
links.text: She falls silent. The wind blows in through the hole in the stained glass window. Cold and moist.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I'm going to leave that out -- but..."
links.text: "I'm going to leave that out -- but the rest... some of this I can use to *start* to explain this to the rest of the team. Maybe I'll sound mad, but..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ma'am, you will *certainly* sound..."
links.text: "Ma'am, you will *certainly* sound mad."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She shrugs. "One more thing -- mayb..."
links.text: She shrugs. "One more thing -- maybe a club for anodic music isn't the *worst* thing you can erect around this particular... *point in space*?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She shrugs. "You know -- maybe a cl..."
links.text: She shrugs. "You know -- maybe a club for anodic music isn't the *worst* thing you can erect around this particular... *point in space*?"

links.title: You: ""Perhaps not.""
links.text: "Perhaps not."

links.title: Egg Head: ""YEAAAGHHH! ONCE THE LIGHT IS ON IN..."
links.text: "YEAAAGHHH! ONCE THE LIGHT IS ON IN THE UNIVERSE -- IT WILL NEVER GO OUT!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Thank you, Egg Head. Let's leave i..."
links.text: "Thank you, Egg Head. Let's leave it at that, shall we? We have un-entroponetic detection to perform in this district."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""What is there to add to that? Noth..."
links.text: "What is there to add to that? Nothing."

links.title: You: ""Yeah, that's still insane, but the..."
links.text: "Yeah, that's still insane, but then again -- so am I."

links.title: You: ""The club is the only thing keeping..."
links.text: "The club is the only thing keeping this place -- and the rest of reality -- together."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I wouldn't go so far as to...""
links.text: "I wouldn't go so far as to..."

links.title: You: ""Actually, now that I think of it,..."
links.text: "Actually, now that I think of it, maybe it's dangerous?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Maybe, but...""
links.text: "Maybe, but..."

links.title: You: ""Simply... *curdling milk*.""
links.text: "Simply... *curdling milk*."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""But the milk -- it clearly hasn't..."
links.text: "But the milk -- it clearly hasn't started curdling yet. We're here and the pale is not."

links.title: Logic: "All you hear is silence in your hea..."
links.text: All you hear is silence in your head.

links.title: You: ""How's the project going? I see tha..."
links.text: "How's the project going? I see that your neighbours have moved in, but all I hear is anodic dance music."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""What?" She leans closer, eyes knit..."
links.text: "What?" She leans closer, eyes knitted together in a puzzled expression. "What-did-you-say?!" You can barely hear her over the thumping bass of anodic dance music.

links.title: You: ""I said -- HOW'S THE PROJECT GOING?""
links.text: "I said -- HOW'S THE PROJECT GOING?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I CAN'T HEAR YOU!" she shouts, poi..."
links.text: "I CAN'T HEAR YOU!" she shouts, pointing at the enormous speaker that's churning out the sound. "THE MUSIC IS TOO LOUD!"

links.title: You: ""THE PROJECT. HOW IS IT GOING?""
links.text: "THE PROJECT. HOW IS IT GOING?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""OH, THE PROJECT!" Her face lights..."
links.text: "OH, THE PROJECT!" Her face lights up for a second, before she gives you an exaggerated headshake. "IT'S NOT GOING WELL!"

links.title: You: ""WHY?""
links.text: "WHY?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""There's that guy." She points at E..."
links.text: "There's that guy." She points at Egg Head, who's raving behind his turntables on a brightly lit stage, "I need him to plug a 3.5 cable into the auxiliary input, so that I can route the audio signal through the mixer into the speakers."

links.title: You: ""SORRY, CAN YOU REPEAT THAT?""
links.text: "SORRY, CAN YOU REPEAT THAT?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""EGG HEAD. A 3.5 CABLE!" She rises..."
links.text: "EGG HEAD. A 3.5 CABLE!" She rises a black cable. "INTO THE AUXILIARY INPUT! OKAY?"

links.title: You: ""Why don't you just ask him?""
links.text: "Why don't you just ask him?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""He doesn't listen to me. He only e..."
links.text: "He doesn't listen to me. He only ever seems to care about *hard core* and *Yekokataa*, 'a place to be' apparently."

links.title: You: ""I'll speak to him, see what I can..."
links.text: "I'll speak to him, see what I can do."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Thanks! Maybe you can get through..."
links.text: "Thanks! Maybe you can get through his *magic rhymes*!" She does jazz hands to mock him.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Let me know how it goes!""
links.text: "Let me know how it goes!"

links.title: You: "Give up trying to communicate in a..."
links.text: Give up trying to communicate in a nightclub.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She shrugs and turns back to her ra..."
links.text: She shrugs and turns back to her radiocomputer.

links.title: You: ""I moved the water bowls to the rig..."
links.text: "I moved the water bowls to the right position, just like you asked. What's next?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Great, everything should be aligne..."
links.text: "Great, everything should be aligned now..." She stops, biting into her chapped lip.

links.title: Empathy: "Miss Know-It-All is hesitating."
links.text: Miss Know-It-All is hesitating.

links.title: You: ""What's wrong?""
links.text: "What's wrong?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yeah," she snaps out of the lull...."
links.text: "Yeah," she snaps out of the lull. "Nothing. Now the only thing left to do is to unmute the headphones."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""If we've got the location right, w..."
links.text: "If we've got the location right, we should then be able to hear whatever sound this anomaly makes."

links.title: You: ""Wait, why did you have your headph..."
links.text: "Wait, why did you have your headphones on mute in the first place?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Honestly..." She's avoiding your g..."
links.text: "Honestly..." She's avoiding your gaze. "Honestly, I'm a little scared."

links.title: You: ""Isn't it going to be just silence..."
links.text: "Isn't it going to be just silence and nothing else?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I don't know." She stares at the h..."
links.text: "I don't know." She stares at the heart of her computer. "That's what I'm scared of: I don't know. It could be *anything*."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I mean, what sound does the nothin..."
links.text: "I mean, what sound does the nothing make? How can you even listen to something that doesn't exist?" She turns to face you, the mainframe throwing shadows on her chin.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""What if silence is only what surro..."
links.text: "What if silence is only what surrounds it, but the swallow itself is..." She grows silent, her face very pale in the cold light of electricity.

links.title: You: ""What?""
links.text: "What?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I don't know, I'm just scared. May..."
links.text: "I don't know, I'm just scared. Maybe it's going to be something terrifying. Maybe it's going to tear the world apart."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Like that evil ink that filled the..."
links.text: Like that evil ink that filled the printout, erasing coherence and meaning.

links.title: You: ""You're overthinking this.""
links.text: "You're overthinking this."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Maybe." She rubs her face. "Maybe..."
links.text: "Maybe." She rubs her face. "Maybe I'm just tired."

links.title: Logic: "Let's think about this -- logically..."
links.text: Let's think about this -- logically. Why would *nothing* be terrifying if it's, well, *nothing*?

links.title: You: ""Why assume that something that has..."
links.text: "Why assume that something that has no presence, existence or qualities has to be terrifying?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Because it reminds us of death. An..."
links.text: "Because it reminds us of death. And we humans tend to think that death is pretty scary."

links.title: Endurance: "Death *is* scary. You can't just st..."
links.text: Death *is* scary. You can't just start over again. Or can you?

links.title: You: ""It's scary, but we just have to fa..."
links.text: "It's scary, but we just have to face it."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yeah..." She breathes in. "You're..."
links.text: "Yeah..." She breathes in. "You're right, let's do it." She puts on her oversized headphones, ready to press UNMUTE on the keyboard...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant takes a step back..."
links.text: The lieutenant takes a step back...

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "And then nothing."
links.text: And then nothing.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "Nothing happens as Soona Luukanen-K..."
links.text: Nothing happens as Soona Luukanen-Kilde presses unmute on her keyboard. Nothing but silence.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "You can hear some small animal cros..."
links.text: You can hear some small animal cross the floor in the chancel -- it's that quiet in the sanctuary.

links.title: You: ""Can you hear anything?""
links.text: "Can you hear anything?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She doesn't answer, her eyes closed..."
links.text: She doesn't answer, her eyes closed and brows knitted together in a state of deep focus, one hand cupping the headphone.

links.title: You: ""Well?""
links.text: "Well?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Damnit." She lets out a loud sigh,..."
links.text: "Damnit." She lets out a loud sigh, before tearing off her headphones; she's still avoiding your gaze.

links.title: You: ""Come on, did you hear anything?""
links.text: "Come on, did you hear anything?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No, of course not," she says, clea..."
links.text: "No, of course not," she says, clearly disappointed. "Nothing happened, let's move on."

links.title: Empathy: "Despite her fear she was hoping for..."
links.text: Despite her fear she was hoping for something extraordinary to take place.

links.title: You: ""What do you mean 'nothing happened..."
links.text: "What do you mean 'nothing happened'? Did you find the swallow?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No." She rests her face on her han..."
links.text: "No." She rests her face on her hands, massaging the forehead.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No, my hypothesis was wrong. Accor..."
links.text: "No, my hypothesis was wrong. According to this, I should have *heard* something if I got the coordinates right. Like I said: silence is only what surrounds it."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""But this..." She raises her head,..."
links.text: "But this..." She raises her head, staring at all the machines that litter the church, cables coiling up on the floor like pests. "This is just another failure. Silence sounds like silence. That's all it is."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""You can try on the headphones, see..."
links.text: "You can try on the headphones, see if you can hear anything, but don't get your hopes up."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Silence is silence? You're sure the..."
links.text: Silence is silence? You're sure there's more to it...

links.title: Logic: "This can't be it. You should have a..."
links.text: This can't be it. You should have a listen.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Great -- and here I thought we wer..."
links.text: "Great -- and here I thought we were finally going to the island..." the lieutenant murmurs to himself.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "'But I *am* interested,' you read f..."
links.text: 'But I *am* interested,' you read from his face.

links.title: Volition: "Great -- you *do know* that we can..."
links.text: Great -- you *do know* that we can just abandon this mission and go to the island? Let's close this case!

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Cuno must be already on the island,..."
links.text: Cuno must be already on the island, wondering where the hell you are... or maybe he doesn't care. Yeah, he probably doesn't care.

links.title: You: ""Well, at least the world seems to..."
links.text: "Well, at least the world seems to be still alright." (Look around.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yeah, yeah," she says, disappointe..."
links.text: "Yeah, yeah," she says, disappointed. "Nothing happened, let's move on."

links.title: You: "(Say nothing.)"
links.text: (Say nothing.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She doesn't talk, her eyes closed a..."
links.text: She doesn't talk, her eyes closed and brows knitted together in a state of deep focus, one hand cupping the headphone.

links.title: You: ""Hey, I don't think I want to do it..."
links.text: "Hey, I don't think I want to do it anymore... seems too *dangerous*." (Slowly start to back off.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No..." She breathes in, determined..."
links.text: "No..." She breathes in, determined. "We *have* to do it." She puts on her oversized headphones, ready to press UNMUTE on the keyboard...

links.title: You: ""You're right, we should be cautiou..."
links.text: "You're right, we should be cautious -- we don't know what we're dealing with here."

links.title: You: ""Okay, let's get this party started!""
links.text: "Okay, let's get this party started!"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yeah," she snaps out of the lull...."
links.text: "Yeah," she snaps out of the lull. "Let's do it. Now the only thing left to do is to unmute the headphones."

links.title: You: ""About the off-site copy you asked..."
links.text: "About the off-site copy you asked me to bring..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes?""
links.text: "Yes?"

links.title: You: ""I brought you the filament." (Give..."
links.text: "I brought you the filament." (Give her the off-site copy.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Thanks." She takes the filament, i..."
links.text: "Thanks." She takes the filament, inspecting the metallic tape on its side. "Looks like it's the one."

links.title: You: ""What's going to happen now?""
links.text: "What's going to happen now?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Now I'm going to print it out to s..."
links.text: "Now I'm going to print it out to see what's left of it." She's already inserted the filament into the radiocomputer's core, ready to close the door.

links.title: You: ""Wait! Don't put it in yet, it migh..."
links.text: "Wait! Don't put it in yet, it might be dangerous!"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She starts laughing, but stops almo..."
links.text: She starts laughing, but stops almost immediately, her voice oddly humourless: "No, it's not dangerous, just depressing."

links.title: You: ""How do you know?""
links.text: "How do you know?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I have a theory," she says, as the..."
links.text: "I have a theory," she says, as the filament clicks into place, "Lintel was able to divine the anomaly's location from this broken copy. I want to repeat their calculation, only this time with better equipment."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Watch," she says and presses PRINT..."
links.text: "Watch," she says and presses PRINT on the machine's keyboard, "what an intricate display of failure."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "The paper starts filling out with i..."
links.text: The paper starts filling out with ink, soaking it in a gleaming darkness. Not a single line of data stands out.

links.title: You: ""What are you even hoping to find?""
links.text: "What are you even hoping to find?"

links.title: You: ""Don't waste your time printing it..."
links.text: "Don't waste your time printing it out, there's nothing but ink there. It's broken."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I know it's just ink," she replies..."
links.text: "I know it's just ink," she replies, as the filament clicks into place, "but Lintel was somehow able to divine the location of the anomaly from this broken copy. I want to repeat their calculation, only this time with better equipment."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Watch," she presses PRINT on the m..."
links.text: "Watch," she presses PRINT on the machine's keyboard, "what an intricate display of failure."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "The paper gets soaked in ink again,..."
links.text: The paper gets soaked in ink again, its evil blackness shining in the light of the mainframe. It looks eerie.

links.title: Interfacing: "This is wrong, machines shouldn't b..."
links.text: This is wrong, machines shouldn't behave like that.

links.title: Half Light: "Cold sweat trickles down your spine..."
links.text: Cold sweat trickles down your spine... This is spooky as hell.

links.title: Conceptualization: "It's the abyss staring back at you."
links.text: It's the abyss staring back at you.

links.title: You: "(Play it cool.) "Now what?""
links.text: (Play it cool.) "Now what?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "Soona doesn't reply, her hands runn..."
links.text: Soona doesn't reply, her hands running over the printout. She's looking for something -- for her morning star -- eyes scouring the millimetres.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Here," she suddenly says, rising h..."
links.text: "Here," she suddenly says, rising her ink-stained fingertip, "I found it."

links.title: You: ""Where?" (Lean closer.)"
links.text: "Where?" (Lean closer.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Hold on." She's behind the keyboar..."
links.text: "Hold on." She's behind the keyboard now, typing in some numbers that only she understands. The terminal beeps, and the light inside starts pulsing like a glowing heart.

links.title: You: ""Can I do anything?""
links.text: "Can I do anything?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Shh... just give me a second, I'm..."
links.text: "Shh... just give me a second, I'm almost..." She clocks up her typing speed.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant leans closer to whis..."
links.text: The lieutenant leans closer to whisper: "I've never witnessed a programmer work before..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Done!" Soona jumps up from the key..."
links.text: "Done!" Soona jumps up from the keyboard like a spring. "I've got it, I've found the location of the anomaly!" There's joy in her voice as she bumps her fist into air.

links.title: You: ""You did it? You found the coordina..."
links.text: "You did it? You found the coordinates?!"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I found the coordinates!" She lets..."
links.text: "I found the coordinates!" She lets out a celebratory laugh.

links.title: Empathy: "She's beaming -- you can feel it in..."
links.text: She's beaming -- you can feel it in your heart.

links.title: Interfacing: "*Great* job!"
links.text: *Great* job!

links.title: You: ""Oh my god, congratulations!""
links.text: "Oh my god, congratulations!"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Thank you!" she yells back with a..."
links.text: "Thank you!" she yells back with a grin.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Time for a celebratory drink perhap..."
links.text: Time for a celebratory drink perhaps...? Just a thought!

links.title: You: ""So -- where is it? Where is your t..."
links.text: "So -- where is it? Where is your two-millimetre hole in the world?" (Proceed.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""There. In the swallow." She points..."
links.text: "There. In the swallow." She points at the other end of the church where a group of water bowls forms a ritualistic arch.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Think you can help me again?" She..."
links.text: "Think you can help me again?" She tilts her head, eyes sparkling.

links.title: You: ""Sure.""
links.text: "Sure."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I need you to go move those water..."
links.text: "I need you to go move those water bowls for me, I need to double-check my calculations."

links.title: Logic: "What an interesting proposition! Tr..."
links.text: What an interesting proposition! Truly a task for the intellectuals -- solving the puzzle of water bowls.

links.title: You: ""Right, I'll go figure it out, I'm..."
links.text: "Right, I'll go figure it out, I'm good at intellectual puzzles."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Figure it out?" She shakes her hea..."
links.text: "Figure it out?" She shakes her head, grinning. "No, I don't need you to figure anything out, I've got a computer for that." She pats the mainframe.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Just walk over to the circle and f..."
links.text: "Just walk over to the circle and follow my instructions: Move the third bowl two centimetres to the left and the fourth bowl five centimetres to the right. This should do the trick."

links.title: Logic: "What? She only wants you to follow..."
links.text: What? She only wants you to follow instructions, nothing *intellectually stimulating* in this task... A child could do it!

links.title: Interfacing: "Yes, but you like moving things aro..."
links.text: Yes, but you like moving things around. Moving things around is calming.

links.title: You: ""What, you don't trust my intellect..."
links.text: "What, you don't trust my intellectual capabilities to solve this problem on my own?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Eh?" She frowns. "Come on, it's no..."
links.text: "Eh?" She frowns. "Come on, it's not about your brain -- even I couldn't figure it out on my own."

links.title: Interfacing: "You like moving things around. Movi..."
links.text: You like moving things around. Moving things around is calming.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Just walk over to the circle and f..."
links.text: "Just walk over to the circle and follow my instructions: Move the third bowl two centimetres to the left and the fourth bowl five centimetres to the right. This should do the trick."

links.title: You: ""Sure, no problem.""
links.text: "Sure, no problem."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Thanks." She smiles."
links.text: "Thanks." She smiles.

links.title: You: ""Do I have a choice?""
links.text: "Do I have a choice?"

links.title: You: ""I'm still not sure it's a good ide..."
links.text: "I'm still not sure it's a good idea -- tinkering with the unknown..."

links.title: You: "(Say nothing.)"
links.text: (Say nothing.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Just give me a second," she murmur..."
links.text: "Just give me a second," she murmurs, "I'm almost..." She clocks up her typing speed.

links.title: You: ""I can't see anything.""
links.text: "I can't see anything."

links.title: You: ""It's that white dot! In the same p..."
links.text: "It's that white dot! In the same place I saw it before when I printed it out."

links.title: You: ""Something's very wrong with that f..."
links.text: "Something's very wrong with that filament memory."

links.title: You: "(Step back.) "Please just... stop...."
links.text: (Step back.) "Please just... stop. Stop playing with this thing!"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Huh?" She looks up, puzzled."
links.text: "Huh?" She looks up, puzzled.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You okay?""
links.text: "You okay?"

links.title: Half Light: "This is embarrassing..."
links.text: This is embarrassing...

links.title: You: ""Nothing, khm, please... continue.""
links.text: "Nothing, khm, please... continue."

links.title: You: ""I'm okay, just please be careful...."
links.text: "I'm okay, just please be careful. Trying to locate a *hole in the world* might be dangerous."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I *am* being careful. Treat it as..."
links.text: "I *am* being careful. Treat it as a mere technical anomaly, makes it easier to bear." She runs her hands over the printout, searching for something...

links.title: You: ""Don't waste your time printing it..."
links.text: "Don't waste your time printing it out, there's nothing but a speck of white in a sea of ink. It's broken."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""A speck of white?" She sounds exci..."
links.text: "A speck of white?" She sounds excited, as the filament clicks into place. "That's exactly what I'm hoping to find."

links.title: You: ""What do you mean?""
links.text: "What do you mean?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Lintel was able to divine the loca..."
