links.text: "Lintel was able to divine the location of the anomaly from this broken copy. I want to repeat their calculation, only this time with better equipment."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Watch," she presses PRINT on the m..."
links.text: "Watch," she presses PRINT on the machine's keyboard, "what an intricate display of failure."

links.title: You: ""What are you even hoping to find?""
links.text: "What are you even hoping to find?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I have a theory," she says, as the..."
links.text: "I have a theory," she says, as the filament clicks into place. "Lintel was able to divine the location of the anomaly from this broken copy. I want to repeat their calculation, only this time with better equipment."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Watch," she says and presses PRINT..."
links.text: "Watch," she says and presses PRINT on the machine's keyboard, "what an intricate display of failure..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "The paper starts filling out with i..."
links.text: The paper starts filling out with ink, soaking it in a gleaming blackness. Not a single line of data stands out.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Wait, no! That's dangerous, she sho..."
links.text: Wait, no! That's dangerous, she shouldn't do it!

links.title: You: ""Is this the filament you're lookin..."
links.text: "Is this the filament you're looking for?" (Show her the production schedule.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No, that's the production schedule..."
links.text: "No, that's the production schedule you stole and accessed without authorization." She's tapping the table in a badly concealed impatience. "I don't need it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In his defence, it was simply lyin..."
links.text: "In his defence, it was simply lying in the desk drawer of an abandoned cubicle."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Okay -- but still.""
links.text: "Okay -- but still."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No, that's the production schedule..."
links.text: "No, that's the production schedule, I don't need it. The right filament memory has 'OFF-SITE COPY' written on silver tape."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "She doesn't care how you got your h..."
links.text: She doesn't care how you got your hands on that thing.

links.title: You: ""I found the ice cream maker, but c..."
links.text: "I found the ice cream maker, but couldn't get it open -- it's completely frozen."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""This is getting ridiculous. Can't..."
links.text: "This is getting ridiculous. Can't you just defrost it? Or I don't know, I don't know about the ice cream maker... just figure something out."

links.title: Empathy: "There's a solution, but she doesn't..."
links.text: There's a solution, but she doesn't want to hand it over to you yet. It's a *thing*, something she holds dear.

links.title: You: ""By the way, we put a dead body in..."
links.text: "By the way, we put a dead body in that fridge."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Wait, what?" She looks up, alarmed..."
links.text: "Wait, what?" She looks up, alarmed. "*Whose* dead body?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You know, we don't actually have t..."
links.text: "You know, we don't actually have to tell the entire world about the fridge," the lieutenant says, looking at you.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Whose body is it?" she demands aga..."
links.text: "Whose body is it?" she demands again, staring first at you, then back at the lieutenant.

links.title: You: ""It's the body of the hanged man.""
links.text: "It's the body of the hanged man."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""*And what is it doing in the fridg..."
links.text: "*And what is it doing in the fridge?!*"

links.title: Empathy: "It's almost as if she feels some so..."
links.text: It's almost as if she feels some sort of ownership of the fridge.

links.title: You: ""Don't worry, I put it there -- tem..."
links.text: "Don't worry, I put it there -- temporarily. It's all part of an official police investigation."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""You put it there..." She leans bac..."
links.text: "You put it there..." She leans back, massaging her eyelids. "You put a dead body inside the ice bear fridge..."

links.title: You: ""Just wanted to let you know.""
links.text: "Just wanted to let you know."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Okay," she says, pressing fingers..."
links.text: "Okay," she says, pressing fingers into her eyebrow ridge. "Very cool, thanks for keeping me in the loop."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We would appreciate it if you kept..."
links.text: "We would appreciate it if you kept this knowledge to yourself, miss."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Who would I tell, my mother?" She..."
links.text: "Who would I tell, my mother?" She shakes her frizzy head. "I don't have anyone to tell -- and if I did, I wouldn't. I don't care."

links.title: You: ""Yeah, that's what I said in the fi..."
links.text: "Yeah, that's what I said in the first place."

links.title: You: ""The investigation warranted it.""
links.text: "The investigation warranted it."

links.title: You: ""I found a note from the ice bear f..."
links.text: "I found a note from the ice bear fridge. It said the off-site copy had been moved to 'a safer place'."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Wait, a note from *whom*?" She fre..."
links.text: "Wait, a note from *whom*?" She freezes. "Did it specify where they took the filament memory?"

links.title: You: ""It said the off-site copy had been..."
links.text: "It said the off-site copy had been taken to a nearby ice cream maker. The note was signed by someone named Sulisław."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Zawisza, of course..." She relaxes..."
links.text: "Zawisza, of course..." She relaxes. "Our project lead Sulisław Zawisza. God, he was always so hell-bent on keeping the copy somewhere 'safe'. And feature creep..." she mutters, "and the Valley of the Heads..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Like it would have made a differen..."
links.text: "Like it would have made a difference -- the off-site copy was perfectly safe when the data loss happened. That data loss was *anomalous*." She crosses her arms defiantly.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""And the Heads -- I won't even get..."
links.text: "And the Heads -- I won't even get *into* the Heads, millions of them..." She stops. "Go find that copy from that ice cream maker, will you? Thanks."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Valley of the Thousand Heads? You l..."
links.text: Valley of the Thousand Heads? You like the sound of that.

links.title: You: ""Why can't you go and get the filam..."
links.text: "Why can't you go and get the filament yourself?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""The bookstore lady hates me -- say..."
links.text: "The bookstore lady hates me -- says I'm part of the *curse*, whatever that means."

links.title: You: ""Wait. Are you -- part of the curse?""
links.text: "Wait. Are you -- part of the curse?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Of course not." She crosses her ar..."
links.text: "Of course not." She crosses her arms. "Anyway, I don't have my keys anymore and she won't let me in."

links.title: You: ""Why does she think you're part of..."
links.text: "Why does she think you're part of the curse?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Because she's from Martinaise and..."
links.text: "Because she's from Martinaise and people from Martinaise have never ever seen a radiocomputer. She thinks it emits elemental *evil*."

links.title: You: ""That's a bit biased, don't you thi..."
links.text: "That's a bit biased, don't you think?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No." She stares at you with droopy..."
links.text: "No." She stares at you with droopy eyes. "She literally started praying for the higher powers when she first saw my Rehm Civic. I'm not making this up."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant coughs like he's amu..."
links.text: The lieutenant coughs like he's amused.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Once I came in one morning only to..."
links.text: "Once I came in one morning only to find that my terminal was full of those strange... trinkets and amulets. *Wards*. It looked like some Semenine magic."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""So what I need you to do here is -..."
links.text: "So what I need you to do here is -- go have a talk with her, say that you're a policeman and need to get to the building's basement. Then bring me the off-site copy. Alright?"

links.title: You: ""Yeah, people in Martinaise don't r..."
links.text: "Yeah, people in Martinaise don't really like to *get with the times*."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""She literally started praying for..."
links.text: "She literally started praying for the higher powers when she first saw my Rehm Civic. I'm not making this up."

links.title: You: ""Don't be too harsh. That's only be..."
links.text: "Don't be too harsh. That's only because of their *socio-economic* situation."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes, but she *literally* started p..."
links.text: "Yes, but she *literally* started praying for the higher powers when she first saw my Rehm Civic. I'm not making this up."

links.title: You: ""What if it *does* emit elemental e..."
links.text: "What if it *does* emit elemental evil?" (Narrow your eyes.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It doesn't *emit*, it receives..."..."
links.text: "It doesn't *emit*, it receives..." She stops explaining. "You sound just like her. She started praying when she first saw my Rehm. Turned to higher powers."

links.title: You: ""What is an off-site copy and why d..."
links.text: "What is an off-site copy and why do you need it?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It's a back-up of my former employ..."
links.text: "It's a back-up of my former employer's project -- the radio game we were working on. It's stored on a *filament memory* just like the one inside this radiocomputer." She points to the glowing cube inside the machine.

links.title: Interfacing: "She's making it *extra simple* for..."
links.text: She's making it *extra simple* for you.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""The backup itself is destroyed now..."
links.text: "The backup itself is destroyed now, but I'm hoping to use what's left of it to pinpoint the exact location of the anomaly. You just have to go to my old workspace and get the filament."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Hold on... If it's called an off-si..."
links.text: Hold on... If it's called an off-site copy, then why is it still *on*-site?

links.title: You: ""If it's called an off-site copy, t..."
links.text: "If it's called an off-site copy, then why is it still on-site?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Oh god, not *this* again..." She t..."
links.text: "Oh god, not *this* again..." She takes a deep breath, before letting it all out: "It is not *on-site*, it is *in the basement*, perfectly safe and not connected to the front *at all*."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Basement? Sounds like it's *technic..."
links.text: Basement? Sounds like it's *technically* still on-site...

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""And no, taking it outside the buil..."
links.text: "And no, taking it outside the building *wouldn't* have protected it from the data loss. There's nothing wrong with keeping the backup in the basement. What happened was a freak accident that has nothing to do with how the backup was stored."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""We clear?" She stares at you with..."
links.text: "We clear?" She stares at you with pleading, furious eyes.

links.title: Empathy: "This is clearly a painful topic for..."
links.text: This is clearly a painful topic for her. She must have had to explain herself numerous times.

links.title: You: ""Where is your old workspace?""
links.text: "Where is your old workspace?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""On Rue de Saint-Ghislaine in the E..."
links.text: "On Rue de Saint-Ghislaine in the East Delta Commerce Centre." She wipes some hair off her face and sighs.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""You might be more familiar with th..."
links.text: "You might be more familiar with the name *Doomed Commercial Area*. You can get in through the bookshop on plaza. You just have to do some explaining to the bookstore lady."

links.title: You: ""By your old workspace do you mean..."
links.text: "By your old workspace do you mean the studio of Fortress Accident in the Doomed Commercial Area?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yeah, that's the one. You can get..."
links.text: "Yeah, that's the one. You can get in through the bookshop. You just have to do some explaining to the bookstore lady."

links.title: You: ""Wait -- bookstore lady -- you mean..."
links.text: "Wait -- bookstore lady -- you mean Plaisance?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""That's her name, I believe.""
links.text: "That's her name, I believe."

links.title: You: ""Actually, I've already been inside..."
links.text: "Actually, I've already been inside the Doomed Commercial Area."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Good -- then you might know the gi..."
links.text: "Good -- then you might know the giant ice bear fridge in the building's cellar. The filament is inside the fridge -- just go and get it."

links.title: You: ""And where exactly is the off-site..."
links.text: "And where exactly is the off-site copy?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""In the giant ice bear fridge -- I..."
links.text: "In the giant ice bear fridge -- I just told you. It has red glowing eyes, it's impossible to miss. You just need to get the off-site copy from the ice bear."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "But... you've been to the fridge an..."
links.text: But... you've been to the fridge and it wasn't there. There was a note saying...

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""There's this giant ice bear fridge..."
links.text: "There's this giant ice bear fridge in the building's cellar -- it's there."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Don't worry, you can't miss the be..."
links.text: "Don't worry, you can't miss the bear." She gives you a rueful smile. "It's hideous."

links.title: You: ""Alright, I'll go look for the off-..."
links.text: "Alright, I'll go look for the off-site copy." (Proceed.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Thanks.""
links.text: "Thanks."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Thanks." She thinks for a moment,..."
links.text: "Thanks." She thinks for a moment, then reaches behind the radiocomputer and hands you what looks like an oversized prybar.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""And here's my Kvalsund multitool...."
links.text: "And here's my Kvalsund multitool. You might need it to hack loose some ice. It opens everything. If you get me the off-site copy, then you can keep the Kvalsund."

links.title: Empathy: "It hurts a bit for her to say this..."
links.text: It hurts a bit for her to say this -- she's not too happy to be parting with the Kvalsund.

links.title: Interfacing: "The *legendary* Kvalsund multitool!..."
links.text: The *legendary* Kvalsund multitool! This is prybar version 2.0 -- for *professionals*, like you.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "This glorious multitool makes a reg..."
links.text: This glorious multitool makes a regular prybar completely OBSOLETE.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Thanks." She thinks for a moment,..."
links.text: "Thanks." She thinks for a moment, then reaches behind the radiocomputer and hands you what looks like an oversized prybar.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Thanks." She thinks for a moment,..."
links.text: "Thanks." She thinks for a moment, then reaches behind the radiocomputer and hands you what looks like an oversized prybar.

links.title: You: ""Those ravers won't be bothering yo..."
links.text: "Those ravers won't be bothering you anymore -- I told them to leave because they were planning a drug trade."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""You told them to leave..." She loo..."
links.text: "You told them to leave..." She looks up, surprised. "Didn't think the cops in this place had it in them," she murmurs.

links.title: You: ""Those ravers won't be bothering yo..."
links.text: "Those ravers won't be bothering you anymore -- I arrested them because they were planning a drug trade."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""You arrested them..." She looks up..."
links.text: "You arrested them..." She looks up, surprised. "Didn't think the cops in this place had it in them," she murmurs.

links.title: You: ""Have you seen the man living up in..."
links.text: "Have you seen the man living up in the rafters?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No.""
links.text: "No."

links.title: You: ""But you know he's around?""
links.text: "But you know he's around?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: You: ""He's seen *you*.""
links.text: "He's seen *you*."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""And?""
links.text: "And?"

links.title: You: ""And? *The crab-man* has seen you!""
links.text: "And? *The crab-man* has seen you!"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I don't care, I don't care about c..."
links.text: "I don't care, I don't care about crab men." She barely looks up, now tinkering with the machine's printer.

links.title: Half Light: "Wow. She really doesn't. Not afraid..."
links.text: Wow. She really doesn't. Not afraid, this one.

links.title: You: ""Okay, it's probably not a big deal..."
links.text: "Okay, it's probably not a big deal then."

links.title: You: ""He must have seen you.""
links.text: "He must have seen you."

links.title: You: ""It sounds like you're not worried..."
links.text: "It sounds like you're not worried about him at all."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No, you're right, I'm not..." Her..."
links.text: "No, you're right, I'm not..." Her voice trails off, as she bends over to tinker with the machine's printer.

links.title: You: ""Have you seen anyone suspicious --..."
links.text: "Have you seen anyone suspicious -- say, a woman named Ruby?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""What? No. No one suspicious around..."
links.text: "What? No. No one suspicious around here."

links.title: Drama: "She hast not seen her, sire. 'Tis t..."
links.text: She hast not seen her, sire. 'Tis true.

links.title: You: ""Why are there so many machines in..."
links.text: "Why are there so many machines in this place?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I brought them here. These are my..."
links.text: "I brought them here. These are my machines. Please don't touch anything."

links.title: You: ""Isn't your Rehm Prefect radiocompu..."
links.text: "Isn't your Rehm Prefect radiocomputer made exclusively for the government-use?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""So you do know *something* about c..."
links.text: "So you do know *something* about computers." She looks up, almost proud of you. "You're right, Prefect *is* used mostly by the government peeps."

links.title: You: ""And you work for the government?""
links.text: "And you work for the government?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No, I don't.""
links.text: "No, I don't."

links.title: You: ""So why do you have it?""
links.text: "So why do you have it?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She inhales sharply, before answeri..."
links.text: She inhales sharply, before answering in a single breath: "Because I needed something *good* for my investigation and Rehm Civic is widely agreed to be below all standards, so I had to upgrade."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Besides, owning a Rehm Prefect isn..."
links.text: "Besides, owning a Rehm Prefect isn't such a big deal anymore."

links.title: Interfacing: "No, actually it *is* kind of a big..."
links.text: No, actually it *is* kind of a big deal. You don't see Rehm Prefects in every police department for example.

links.title: You: ""How did you get your hands on it?""
links.text: "How did you get your hands on it?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I know a friend of a friend who us..."
links.text: "I know a friend of a friend who used to freelance for the Coalition," she says nonchalantly, scratching her ear. "I was actually aiming for the military-grade Rehm Rational series, but couldn't find one."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She pats her glowing machine. "Pref..."
links.text: She pats her glowing machine. "Prefect is mainly based on the same technology as Rehm Civic, so it's kind of a rip-off, but it does have better compatibility with newer antenna models, so I won't complain."

links.title: You: ""Did you *steal it*?""
links.text: "Did you *steal it*?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No!" She looks up, disturbed. "No,..."
links.text: "No!" She looks up, disturbed. "No, of course not. I know a friend of a friend who used to freelance for the Coalition. I bought it from her."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I was actually aiming for the mili..."
links.text: "I was actually aiming for the military-grade Rehm Rational series, but couldn't find one." She pats her machine: "Prefect is mainly based on the same technology as the Civic, but it does work better with newer antenna models, so I'm not complaining."

links.title: You: ""Why do you need an antenna?" (Poin..."
links.text: "Why do you need an antenna?" (Point to it.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I use the AR-1 as my Rehm Prefect'..."
links.text: "I use the AR-1 as my Rehm Prefect's processing unit."

links.title: You: ""Wait, what?""
links.text: "Wait, what?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Rehm Prefect, my radiocomputer," s..."
links.text: "Rehm Prefect, my radiocomputer," she explains.

links.title: You: ""And that antenna is its... process..."
links.text: "And that antenna is its... processing unit?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes." She sighs. "You really don't..."
links.text: "Yes." She sighs. "You really don't know anything about radiocomputers, do you?" She has stopped working now.

links.title: You: ""No, I'm a master circuit-bender, I..."
links.text: "No, I'm a master circuit-bender, I know *everything*."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Then you *certainly* know that all..."
links.text: "Then you *certainly* know that all radiocomputers perform operations on air, so in order to gain more processing power you need to invest in a good antenna."

links.title: You: ""Wait, what's 'on air'`?""
links.text: "Wait, what's 'on air'`?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""On the *front*. The unified front..."
links.text: "On the *front*. The unified front of radiowaves, licensed and controlled by Lintel in the East-Insulindic region."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It's all around us," she waves her..."
links.text: "It's all around us," she waves her hand, "that's what 'on air' means."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Like love."
links.text: Like love.

links.title: You: ""And the AR-1? Is it a 'good antenn..."
links.text: "And the AR-1? Is it a 'good antenna'?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I guess it is…" She stops to think..."
links.text: "I guess it is…" She stops to think. "So far I've been quite satisfied with it. Martinaise is an unstable region with bad coverage and the operation has been surprisingly stable."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""But it's not the cheapest one on t..."
links.text: "But it's not the cheapest one on the market, so I wouldn't recommend it for your regular red tape operations. Fraser 1000 is a foolproof line for civilians."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Anyway..." She turns back to her t..."
links.text: "Anyway..." She turns back to her terminal. "You should do some research before you decide to buy anything. Ask around, compare the prices. There are many milieus dedicated to that sort of thing."

links.title: Empathy: "She liked telling you this. It calm..."
links.text: She liked telling you this. It calmed her nerves.

links.title: You: ""Not really.""
links.text: "Not really."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Alright, well... All radiocomputer..."
links.text: "Alright, well... All radiocomputers perform operations up on air, so in order to gain more processing power you need to invest in a *good antenna*."

links.title: You: ""I know *a little*.""
links.text: "I know *a little*."

links.title: You: ""I don't really know much about *an..."
links.text: "I don't really know much about *anything* in this world, to be honest."

links.title: You: ""I don't understand.""
links.text: "I don't understand."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Rehm Prefect is my radiocomputer,"..."
links.text: "Rehm Prefect is my radiocomputer," she explains.

links.title: You: ""Rehm Prefect, that's your radiocom..."
links.text: "Rehm Prefect, that's your radiocomputer, right?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Mhmh.""
links.text: "Mhmh."

links.title: You: ""What are you doing with your radio..."
links.text: "What are you doing with your radiocomputer?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I'm working.""
links.text: "I'm working."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "The machine seems almost alien with..."
links.text: The machine seems almost alien with its pulsing core, the light casting her face in a strange shadow.

links.title: You: ""Working on what?""
links.text: "Working on what?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Could you..." She closes her eyes...."
links.text: "Could you..." She closes her eyes. "Could you just... *shh* for a moment? Or get to the point -- I really need to focus on something."

links.title: Volition: "It's not *just* rudeness. It really..."
links.text: It's not *just* rudeness. It really is hard to concentrate on whatever she needs to do. And you're not helping.

links.title: You: ""What about those bowls of water ov..."
links.text: "What about those bowls of water over there?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""They are connected to my Rehm Pref..."
links.text: "They are connected to my Rehm Prefect." She looks up. "Whatever you do, just please don't move them, okay? Thanks."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Short and terse -- there you have i..."
links.text: Short and terse -- there you have it. Whatever she's using them for, they're hers.

links.title: You: ""Right, I'll try not to touch anyth..."
links.text: "Right, I'll try not to touch anything. Next question..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Great." She dwells back into the g..."
links.text: "Great." She dwells back into the glowing terminal.

links.title: You: ""Hey, about that two-millimetre hol..."
links.text: "Hey, about that two-millimetre hole again..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""The swallow, you mean." She looks..."
links.text: "The swallow, you mean." She looks up, slightly irked. "What about it?"

links.title: You: ""Does it have anything to do with *..."
links.text: "Does it have anything to do with *ghosts*?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""*Ghosts?*" she repeats. "No, I don..."
links.text: "*Ghosts?*" she repeats. "No, I don't think so, I don't believe in ghosts."

links.title: You: ""What about other supra-natural ent..."
links.text: "What about other supra-natural entities?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I don't believe in them either.""
links.text: "I don't believe in them either."

links.title: You: ""What not many know is: necroplasma..."
links.text: "What not many know is: necroplasma *exists*."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Great. What are we talking about?..."
links.text: "Great. What are we talking about? And *why*?" She gets back to work -- a clear signal that this branch of the conversation is over.

links.title: You: "(Nod.) "That's probably wise. Not b..."
links.text: (Nod.) "That's probably wise. Not believing in them."

links.title: You: ""Right, nothing to do with ghosts...""
links.text: "Right, nothing to do with ghosts..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You do know there's no need to off..."
links.text: "You do know there's no need to officially document this information, right?" the lieutenant whispers to you.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She has already turned back to her..."
links.text: She has already turned back to her keyboard.

links.title: You: ""Is the hole connected to the data..."
links.text: "Is the hole connected to the data loss in your journal?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes, that's what led me here..." S..."
links.text: "Yes, that's what led me here..." She stares at the burnished antenna on a nearby table. "But I suspect it might be something a bit more complicated than that."

links.title: You: ""A hole in the world... What does t..."
links.text: "A hole in the world... What does that mean exactly?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Exactly, what *does* it mean?" The..."
links.text: "Exactly, what *does* it mean?" There's something frantic about her as she locks her gaze with you, eyes shining like pearls. "Up to now it has been impossible to say what it is, because it's impossible to measure *nothing*."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""What do *you* think it is? What qu..."
links.text: "What do *you* think it is? What qualities does *nothing* have? How do you measure something that does not exist?" She's suddenly absorbed in the conversation, waiting for your answer.

links.title: Logic: "Easy, you measure it by the world a..."
links.text: Easy, you measure it by the world around it.

links.title: Logic: "That's a little above your pay grad..."
links.text: That's a little above your pay grade at the moment.

links.title: You: ""Hold on a moment --  does it mean..."
links.text: "Hold on a moment --  does it mean we're now living in a world that has *holes in it*?!"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I don't know, are we? That's what..."
links.text: "I don't know, are we? That's what I'm trying to figure out here. But how *do* I figure it out?"

links.title: You: ""You measure it by collecting data..."
links.text: "You measure it by collecting data on its surroundings, on that which exists."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Exactly," she nods, "very true! Th..."
links.text: "Exactly," she nods, "very true! That's what I've been aiming for, that's why I have those basins. I've tried using hydrotransducers to record the silence -- to find out where it *begins*."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Hah! Hydrotransducers. So that's wh..."
links.text: Hah! Hydrotransducers. So that's what those water basins are -- devices for recording sound through water.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""But honestly, it's not progressing..."
links.text: "But honestly, it's not progressing very well." She grows silent, staring at her circle of basins -- it looks like some ancient ritual.

links.title: Inland Empire: "But does it have anything to do wit..."
links.text: But does it have anything to do with necroplasmic life forms? 'Ghosts' in everyday parlance.

links.title: You: ""I can't even understand how we're..."
links.text: "I can't even understand how we're talking about something that doesn't exist, let alone measure it."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""You measure it by its surroundings..."
links.text: "You measure it by its surroundings -- by that which does exist," she replies, "which is what I've been trying to do. I've tried using hydrotransducers to record the silence -- to find out where it *begins*."

links.title: You: ""I don't know, I'm not here for som..."
links.text: "I don't know, I'm not here for some science, I just want to solve a murder so I can go home."

links.title: You: ""Do you have any idea where this ho..."
links.text: "Do you have any idea where this hole might be located?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Somewhere underneath those roof be..."
links.text: "Somewhere underneath those roof beams, I assume." She looks up, eyes trying to pierce the pitch-black heights above, but without much success.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Only a faint criss-cross of rafters..."
links.text: Only a faint criss-cross of rafters can be made out from the dark, most of the tower disappearing into the shade.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Strange things may flourish in the..."
links.text: Strange things may flourish in the dark...

links.title: You: ""Why there?""
links.text: "Why there?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""There's this place at the back of..."
links.text: "There's this place at the back of the church, a place where all audible vibrations seem to decease -- I've named it 'the swallow'. And the higher you go, the less you record."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The pillar of silence? Are you sur..."
links.text: "The pillar of silence? Are you sure it's not just an architectural quirk?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Maybe. But it's oddly close to the..."
links.text: "Maybe. But it's oddly close to the physical coordinates of the data loss that led me to this place."

links.title: You: ""This is where the crab-man lives.""
links.text: "This is where the crab-man lives."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I know.""
links.text: "I know."

links.title: You: ""You don't think crab-man might be..."
links.text: "You don't think crab-man might be somehow responsible here?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No, I don't.""
links.text: "No, I don't."

links.title: Empathy: "She sounds mildly annoyed by this l..."
links.text: She sounds mildly annoyed by this line of questioning, her hands typing hundreds of commands into the machine.

links.title: You: ""You said that the research isn't g..."
links.text: "You said that the research isn't going well. Why not?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Because it's just trial and error,..."
links.text: "Because it's just trial and error, trying to locate the swallow -- the exact point in space."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""The off-site copy you brought me h..."
links.text: "The off-site copy you brought me helps, but..." She stops mid-sentence. "You know what, it would be great if you could just stop talking and let me work."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""If you could bring me the off-site..."
links.text: "If you could bring me the off-site copy then it would help -- a lot."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""And I don't have a..." She stops m..."
links.text: "And I don't have a..." She stops mid-sentence. "You know what, it would be really helpful if you could just stop talking and let me work."

links.title: You: ""That's all I wanted to know about..."
links.text: "That's all I wanted to know about the scary two-millimetre hole in the world... for now." (Conclude.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Great." Her hands are a whirl on t..."
links.text: "Great." Her hands are a whirl on the keyboard. "Thanks."

links.title: You: ""What are you doing in an abandoned..."
links.text: "What are you doing in an abandoned church?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""You really like those questions, d..."
links.text: "You really like those questions, don't you?" There's a hint of amusement in her tired eyes.

links.title: Endurance: "They're bloodshot. She really hasn'..."
links.text: They're bloodshot. She really hasn't been getting much sleep lately, has she?

links.title: You: ""I need to make sure you're not hid..."
links.text: "I need to make sure you're not hiding anyone here."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No, I'm not, it's just me and the...."
links.text: "No, I'm not, it's just me and the..." She looks up at the ceiling before murmuring: "...*the crab-man*. I'm just doing some research. That's all."

links.title: You: ""What research?""
links.text: "What research?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No, I'm not, it's just me and the...."
links.text: "No, I'm not, it's just me and the..." She looks up at the ceiling without finishing her sentence. "I'm just doing some research. That's all."

links.title: You: ""I'm a police officer, it's my job..."
links.text: "I'm a police officer, it's my job to ask questions."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I am conducting scientific researc..."
links.text: "I am conducting scientific research here. You can't throw me out," she says, ready to stand her ground.

links.title: You: ""What research?""
links.text: "What research?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I'm looking for the location of a..."
links.text: "I'm looking for the location of a two-millimetre hole in the world."

links.title: You: ""You're occupying a public space. I..."
links.text: "You're occupying a public space. I need to know what you're doing here."

links.title: You: ""There have been complaints from yo..."
links.text: "There have been complaints from your neighbours."

links.title: You: ""I'd really like to know more about..."
links.text: "I'd really like to know more about your research."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Well. Since you're asking then...""
links.text: "Well. Since you're asking then..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I'm looking for the location of a..."
links.text: "I'm looking for the location of a two-millimetre hole in the world."

links.title: Logic: "Wait, what?"
links.text: Wait, what?

links.title: Interfacing: "She's looking for a disruption in t..."
links.text: She's looking for a disruption in the *radio waves*. That's what her personal log said.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant raises his brows, bu..."
links.text: The lieutenant raises his brows, but doesn't say anything.

links.title: You: ""How do you feel about *anodic danc..."
links.text: "How do you feel about *anodic dance music*?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""What?" She squints her eyes. "I ha..."
links.text: "What?" She squints her eyes. "I hate it."

links.title: Conceptualization: "I bet she hasn't even heard it."
links.text: I bet she hasn't even heard it.

links.title: You: ""Have you even *listened* to it? Li..."
links.text: "Have you even *listened* to it? Like *actually* listened?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yeah, like all the time. My tent-n..."
links.text: "Yeah, like all the time. My tent-neighbours don't really ease up with their partying, do they?" She pulls a face that looks absolutely scathing.

links.title: You: ""What are you, *forty*? It's the fu..."
links.text: "What are you, *forty*? It's the future of dance music!"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Maybe I'd have to be *on drugs* to..."
links.text: "Maybe I'd have to be *on drugs* to get it, but to a sober mind it just sounds like uninspired rug whipping. No idea what it has to do with either dancing or music."

links.title: You: ""Right, right... but how do you fee..."
links.text: "Right, right... but how do you feel about a *club* for anodic dance music?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""This is about those speedfreaks in..."
links.text: "This is about those speedfreaks in the tent, isn't it?" She looks up, shaking her head. "I've got some news for you, it's not a *nightclub* they want to build here..."

links.title: You: ""What do they want to build then?""
links.text: "What do they want to build then?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Take a guess, why don't you?""
links.text: "Take a guess, why don't you?"

links.title: You: ""I heard they're also planning on b..."
links.text: "I heard they're also planning on building a drug lab."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Bingo." She snaps her fingers. "Th..."
links.text: "Bingo." She snaps her fingers. "That's exactly what they're up to."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Wonderful," the lieutenant whisper..."
links.text: "Wonderful," the lieutenant whispers, admiring the embellished pillars and the spectacular architecture in the church.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now this house of worship is also..."
links.text: "Now this house of worship is also going to be a drug lab... Always something fascinating happening in tents."

links.title: You: ""They're just encouraging an active..."
links.text: "They're just encouraging an active *youth culture* here, nothing wrong with that."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yeah, what I said before... Not po..."
links.text: "Yeah, what I said before... Not possible to appreciate that kind of music without being high as a kite."

links.title: You: ""Mind-altering substances are a vit..."
links.text: "Mind-altering substances are a vital part of anodic club scene, it helps to bring the community together."

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""So that's settled, great." She sup..."
links.text: "So that's settled, great." She supports her chin on her hand, visibly pleased: "No nightclubs in the church then."

links.title: You: ""A youth centre would be nice.""
links.text: "A youth centre would be nice."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "The lead programmer sighs. "I can't..."
links.text: The lead programmer sighs. "I can't believe they got you so easily. Go have another talk with those up-and-coming entrepreneurs, will you? Thanks."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good luck," the lieutenant notes...."
links.text: "Good luck," the lieutenant notes. "I'm *not* coming in there."

links.title: You: ""A petting zoo, a place for animals!""
links.text: "A petting zoo, a place for animals!"

links.title: You: ""Maybe some community space to help..."
links.text: "Maybe some community space to help the elderly?"

links.title: You: ""I'm still convinced they want to e..."
links.text: "I'm still convinced they want to establish a nightclub for anodic dance music -- they said it's their *dream*."

links.title: You: ""Same here, it just doesn't *connec..."
links.text: "Same here, it just doesn't *connect* here..." (Tap on your heart.) "Not like disco does, anyway."

links.title: You: ""Okay. Wow. That was quick. Why do..."
links.text: "Okay. Wow. That was quick. Why do you hate it?"

links.title: You: ""How do you feel about manufacturin..."
links.text: "How do you feel about manufacturing large quantities of drugs?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I see you've talked to them, good...."
links.text: "I see you've talked to them, good. Drugs are illegal, and I'm not leaving this church -- especially because of some corrupt drug lab idea you've cooked up in that tent."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Wonderful," the lieutenant whisper..."
links.text: "Wonderful," the lieutenant whispers. "Now this place is also going to be a drug lab. Always something fascinating happening in tents."

links.title: Volition: "His way to deal with this is -- at..."
links.text: His way to deal with this is -- at this point -- not to care. Do what you want.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Wait! No-no-no. You can't say thing..."
links.text: Wait! No-no-no. You can't say things like that when the lieutenant is present. Say it's a joke!

links.title: You: ""I'm just encouraging an active *yo..."
links.text: "I'm just encouraging an active *youth culture*, nothing wrong with that."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, don't mind me, go on with your..."
links.text: "No, don't mind me, go on with your little project. I'm sure you can spin it as an under-cover op. Many cops do."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Just to be completely clear: I am..."
links.text: "Just to be completely clear: I am here to conduct a citizen's investigation into a radio anomaly and I want nothing to do with the local vices of Martinaise. Got it? Thanks." She turns back to work.

links.title: You: ""Mind-altering substances are a vit..."
links.text: "Mind-altering substances are a vital part of anodic club scene. It helps to bring the community together."

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: You: ""Whoa, guys! I was just messing wit..."
links.text: "Whoa, guys! I was just messing with you." (Wave your hands around your head.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Just 'messing with us'. Right. Wel..."
links.text: "Just 'messing with us'. Right. Well..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Good.""
links.text: "Good."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Oh yeah, told you -- radiocomputer..."
links.text: Oh yeah, told you -- radiocomputer wizards don't care.

links.title: You: ""Really?""
links.text: "Really?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No, of course not." She turns her..."
links.text: "No, of course not." She turns her tired, sardonic eyes to face you. "I feel even worse about drugs than I feel about nightclubs."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Just to be completely clear: I am..."
links.text: "Just to be completely clear: I am here to conduct a citizen's investigation into a radio anomaly and I want nothing to do with the local vices of Martinaise. Okay? Thanks."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I feel that's illegal.""
links.text: "I feel that's illegal."

links.title: Suggestion: "Hey, hey, what are you doing -- lay..."
links.text: Hey, hey, what are you doing -- laying everything out like that?!

links.title: Electrochemistry: "She's a radiocomputer wizard. Radio..."
links.text: She's a radiocomputer wizard. Radiocomputer wizards don't care. She probably thinks it's illegal -- *and* fun.

links.title: You: ""Right, isn't that what makes it fu..."
links.text: "Right, isn't that what makes it fun?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No, certainly not. I've got a citi..."
links.text: "No, certainly not. I've got a citizen's investigation to run and I want nothing to do with local vices."

links.title: You: ""Your feeling is right, manufacturi..."
links.text: "Your feeling is right, manufacturing drugs is a little illegal."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes, I know that.""
links.text: "Yes, I know that."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It is, yes. It's against the law...."
links.text: "It is, yes. It's against the law. We're cops -- the law is *important* to us."

links.title: You: ""What if I'd just force you to leav..."
links.text: "What if I'd just force you to leave? I'm a police officer. You have to do what I say."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Oh, I see," the lieutenant says, r..."
links.text: "Oh, I see," the lieutenant says, raising a finger, "this is connected to the drug manufacturing thing."

links.title: You: ""Gotcha. It's almost party time!""
links.text: "Gotcha. It's almost party time!"

links.title: You: ""How could you? This is a completel..."
links.text: "How could you? This is a completely separate issue!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Apologies, I was just thinking out..."
links.text: "Apologies, I was just thinking out loud. Go on."

links.title: You: "(Ignore him and address the lead pr..."
links.text: (Ignore him and address the lead programmer) "I want you to take your belongings and leave within an hour."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Interesting, a police officer tryi..."
links.text: "Interesting, a police officer trying to evict a citizen from a public space despite the Wayfarer Act."

links.title: You: ""It's really hard to be a *cop* wit..."
links.text: "It's really hard to be a *cop* with all these *laws*!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's the Wayfarer Act again," the..."
links.text: "It's the Wayfarer Act again," the lieutenant says, nodding. "You can't just throw citizens out of public spaces, at least not legally."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes, thank you. Now, if you'd only..."
links.text: "Yes, thank you. Now, if you'd only let me work..."

links.title: You: ""No, please, not the Wayfarer Act a..."
links.text: "No, please, not the Wayfarer Act again..." (Close your eyes.)

links.title: You: ""What's the Wayfarer Act?""
links.text: "What's the Wayfarer Act?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""The Wayfarer Act states that citiz..."
links.text: "The Wayfarer Act states that citizens have the right to gather in public spaces unless they're disrupting the public order."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And she's not. Disrupting any orde..."
links.text: "And she's not. Disrupting any order, I mean."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I'm a circuit bender and no one ev..."
links.text: "I'm a circuit bender and no one ever has anything against circuit benders."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""And before you go on, I am *not* d..."
links.text: "And before you go on, I am *not* disrupting any order here, I'm a circuit bender and no one has anything against circuit benders."

links.title: Half Light: "Look at how pleased she is with her..."
links.text: Look at how pleased she is with herself, playing with her 'important science machines'. Academics!!

links.title: You: "(Cross your arms.) "There is no Way..."
links.text: (Cross your arms.) "There is no Wayfarer Act."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Ah, but there *is* and it *protect..."
links.text: "Ah, but there *is* and it *protects* me!"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""What?" She snorts with disdain. "I..."
links.text: "What?" She snorts with disdain. "I'm not going anywhere. This is a public space and I am free to bend the circuit as I find necessary. Besides..."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "A small satisfied smile breaks free..."
links.text: A small satisfied smile breaks free on her face, infuriatingly triumphant.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I'm protected by the Wayfarer Act.""
links.text: "I'm protected by the Wayfarer Act."

links.title: You: ""What if you *didn't* have to leave..."
links.text: "What if you *didn't* have to leave? I talked to Andre, he wants to make it work."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I don't want to make anything work..."
links.text: "I don't want to make anything work," she replies, her expression unchanged.

links.title: You: ""Hold on, you don't want to make *a..."
links.text: "Hold on, you don't want to make *anything* work?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes, *anything*. I don't want to m..."
links.text: "Yes, *anything*. I don't want to make anything work."

links.title: Empathy: "It's not the anodic dance music tha..."
links.text: It's not the anodic dance music that's made her bitter... it's the failure of Fortress Accident.

links.title: You: ""Are you bitter because your radio..."
links.text: "Are you bitter because your radio game project failed?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""That's right." Something strange s..."
links.text: "That's right." Something strange shines in her eyes. "If we couldn't get our *welkins* to happen, I don't want anything to happen. Ever again."

links.title: Empathy: "There's not a trace of irony in her..."
links.text: There's not a trace of irony in her voice. She means it.

links.title: You: "Don't bring it up."
links.text: Don't bring it up.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She gets back to work."
links.text: She gets back to work.

links.title: You: ""Alright, got your message.""
links.text: "Alright, got your message."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Good." She gets back to work."
links.text: "Good." She gets back to work.

links.title: You: "Evict her."
links.text: Evict her.

links.title: Half Light: "All you hear is the accelerated hea..."
links.text: All you hear is the accelerated heart rate in your ears, pounding at 100bpm. Beat by beat, your blood readies for conflict.

links.title: You: ""You're leaving this church..." (Ta..."
links.text: "You're leaving this church..." (Take out your gun.) "...one way or another."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Detective...""
links.text: "Detective..."

links.title: Empathy: "There's caution in his voice."
links.text: There's caution in his voice.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""God..." The girl immediately steps..."
links.text: "God..." The girl immediately steps back and raises her hands. "Easy now, I'll go, it's not an issue! Can I pack my things first?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Put the gun down, detective." The..."
links.text: "Put the gun down, detective." The lieutenant's voice is low and firm.

links.title: You: ""I'm not putting down my gun unless..."
links.text: "I'm not putting down my gun unless she promises to be gone when I come back."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I promise, I promise!" she exclaim..."
links.text: "I promise, I promise!" she exclaims, words echoing below the ceiling rafters.

links.title: Authority: "Finally, compliance."
links.text: Finally, compliance.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Her lower lip is quivering."
links.text: Her lower lip is quivering.

links.title: You: ""Good." (Put away your gun.)"
links.text: "Good." (Put away your gun.)

links.title: You: ""Miss, I need you to be gone from t..."
links.text: "Miss, I need you to be gone from this church when I come back." (Put away your gun.)

links.title: You: ""You better start going if you don'..."
links.text: "You better start going if you don't want to be frogmarched to the jail." (Roll up your sleeves.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""God..." She immediately steps back..."
links.text: "God..." She immediately steps back and raises her hands, sensing the aggression. "Easy now, I'll go. It's not an issue. Can I pack my things first?"

links.title: You: "(Nod once.) "Just make sure you're..."
links.text: (Nod once.) "Just make sure you're gone by the time I get back."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant sighs, but says noth..."
links.text: The lieutenant sighs, but says nothing.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Okay." She lets out a relieved sig..."
links.text: "Okay." She lets out a relieved sigh. "I'll go make a phone call outside and then return for my things. You can tell the ravers that they can move in."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She turns off her computer and leav..."
links.text: She turns off her computer and leaves.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Okay." She lets out a relieved sig..."
links.text: "Okay." She lets out a relieved sigh. "I'll go make a phone call outside and then return for my things. You can tell the ravers that they can move in."

links.title: You: ""Fuck your things. Get out now.""
links.text: "Fuck your things. Get out now."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Is that *really* necessary, detect..."
links.text: "Is that *really* necessary, detective?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Okay, I'm going. You can tell the..."
links.text: "Okay, I'm going. You can tell the ravers that they can move in."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She turns off her computer and leav..."
links.text: She turns off her computer and leaves.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Okay, I'm going. You can tell the..."
links.text: "Okay, I'm going. You can tell the ravers that they can move in."

links.title: Half Light: "You're not really feeling it, but y..."
links.text: You're not really feeling it, but you should try to force it, anyway. Maybe she won't be able to tell?

links.title: You: ""I don't *care* about the Wayfarer..."
links.text: "I don't *care* about the Wayfarer Act! Get out of here!" (Stomp your feet.)

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No, but you see, it doesn't matter..."
links.text: "No, but you see, it doesn't matter whether you care about it or not. It's the law," she explains to you without even sparing a look, "I'm not going anywhere."

links.title: You: ""Wait, I have my... I have my..." (..."
links.text: "Wait, I have my... I have my..." (Take out your gun.)

links.title: Half Light: "But you don't take out your gun --..."
links.text: But you don't take out your gun -- instead you fumble with the holster, desperately trying to free the weapon from its pouch... It looks pathetic.

links.title: You: ""Please just go, will you? Please....."
links.text: "Please just go, will you? Please... Pretty please, I don't want to fight. Fighting is scary, and gives me breathing difficulties."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Have some dignity," the woman sigh..."
links.text: "Have some dignity," the woman sighs, turning back to her radiocomputer.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant pretends he didn't s..."
links.text: The lieutenant pretends he didn't see your little temper tantrum, preferring to inspect the golden stained glass window instead.

links.title: You: ""You're right. The Wayfarer Act is..."
links.text: "You're right. The Wayfarer Act is the foundation of our legal order. I can't cross it on a whim. You're welcome to stay."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Of course I can stay. It wasn't ev..."
links.text: "Of course I can stay. It wasn't even a question."

links.title: You: "I can't do it. I don't *feel* scary..."
links.text: I can't do it. I don't *feel* scary.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She's still typing behind the radio..."
links.text: She's still typing behind the radiocomputer, her sweater-clad frame hunched over the machine.

links.title: Authority: "You don't *feel* scary? What are yo..."
links.text: You don't *feel* scary? What are you, some kind of *diva*?

links.title: You: "Convince her to cooperate with the..."
links.text: Convince her to cooperate with the ravers.

links.title: Suggestion: "Just tell her about Egg Head's defe..."
links.text: Just tell her about Egg Head's defence speech.

links.title: You: ""Listen, about that nightclub...""
links.text: "Listen, about that nightclub..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I already told you -- I'm not inte..."
links.text: "I already told you -- I'm not interested."

links.title: You: ""Those kids really need a win. We a..."
links.text: "Those kids really need a win. We all do. Give this club a chance -- give them a chance."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""A chance to cook some speed, you m..."
links.text: "A chance to cook some speed, you mean?" she asks sourly, crossing her arms.

links.title: You: ""They *promised* they'll do it clea..."
links.text: "They *promised* they'll do it clean."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Uh, *did they*?" she asks, clickin..."
links.text: "Uh, *did they*?" she asks, clicking her tongue. A moment passes.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Alright, this is all very good and..."
links.text: "Alright, this is all very good and sad, but I have my research to finish. Trust me, this is far more important than the fate of some local speedfreaks and their dance music."

links.title: Suggestion: "Wait! she doesn't want to share the..."
links.text: Wait! she doesn't want to share the space with them -- help her finish the research, then she won't have to! Offer to help.

links.title: You: ""What if I helped you *finish* your..."
links.text: "What if I helped you *finish* your project? Then you could leave -- and they could come in."

links.title: You: ""This is Martinaise, what can you e..."
links.text: "This is Martinaise, what can you expect? They're the product of their surroundings."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Very cool, but I don't want any pa..."
links.text: "Very cool, but I don't want any part of those 'surroundings' myself, good or bad."

links.title: Suggestion: "Wait! She doesn't want to share the..."
links.text: Wait! She doesn't want to share the space with them -- you can help her finish the research, then she won't have to! Offer to help.

links.title: You: ""What if I helped you *finish* your..."
links.text: "What if I helped you *finish* your project? Then you could leave -- and they could come in."

links.title: Suggestion: "Easy -- when her research is done,..."
links.text: Easy -- when her research is done, she can move out.

links.title: You: ""Listen, about your research... You..."
links.text: "Listen, about your research... You mentioned earlier that it's not going very well. Maybe I can help with something?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""What?" She looks up from her work,..."
links.text: "What?" She looks up from her work, disoriented. "No, I don't really need any help with the project."

links.title: You: ""But if I could help you finish the..."
links.text: "But if I could help you finish the project then you wouldn't have to live in a church next to the boom-boom anymore -- just think about it."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She thinks about it, a glassy look..."
links.text: She thinks about it, a glassy look in her eyes. A gust of wind brings more snow in from the broken gallery. It touches her hair.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Alright," she finally says, blinki..."
links.text: "Alright," she finally says, blinking twice. "Bring me the game's off-site copy from my old workspace if you really want to help. It's stored on a filament memory and I'm unable to go and fetch it myself."

links.title: You: ""Listen, about your research... May..."
links.text: "Listen, about your research... Maybe I can help with anything? Help you refill those water basins or something..."

links.title: Suggestion: "Hey, what makes the world go round?"
links.text: Hey, what makes the world go round?

links.title: You: ""Listen, how about we offer you par..."
links.text: "Listen, how about we offer you part of the profit?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Nope, not interested in your degen..."
links.text: "Nope, not interested in your degenerate money schemes."

links.title: Suggestion: "Hey, maybe if you were to find out..."
links.text: Hey, maybe if you were to find out more about her previous company, Fortress Accident, you'd have something new to say...

links.title: You: "No, that's a bad idea -- don't say..."
links.text: No, that's a bad idea -- don't say anything.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She stares at the terminal, complet..."
links.text: She stares at the terminal, completely oblivious to her surroundings.

links.title: You: "Put on the headphones."
links.text: Put on the headphones.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Everything disappears. You are drap..."
links.text: Everything disappears. You are draped in silence like a drowning man staring into his puny little headspace.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "And then the pressure changes."
links.text: And then the pressure changes.

links.title: You: "What does it mean?"
links.text: What does it mean?

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "It feels like flying on an aerostat..."
links.text: It feels like flying on an aerostatic, or when your ears pop, or like a subtle difference in the atmosphere, a weather change hanging in the air...

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "What if the sound you're looking fo..."
links.text: What if the sound you're looking for is too low for you to hear it?

links.title: You: ""Soona..." (Take off the headphones..."
links.text: "Soona..." (Take off the headphones.) "What if we just need a better sound system?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""A better sound system?" she repeat..."
links.text: "A better sound system?" she repeats. "Alright... But where would we get one?"

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Suddenly a rhythmic beat permeates..."
links.text: Suddenly a rhythmic beat permeates the walls, causing a small patch of decorative stucco to crumble onto the wooden floor.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""They should really allocate some r..."
links.text: "They should really allocate some renovation funds to this place..." murmurs the lieutenant, inspecting the damage done to the arabesques.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No, what they *really* should do i..."
links.text: "No, what they *really* should do is shut down the discomen for disturbing neighbourhood peace."

links.title: You: ""Yes, but they could help with the..."
links.text: "Yes, but they could help with the speakers..."

links.title: You: ""From your neighbours, of course.""
links.text: "From your neighbours, of course."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""You mean the *speedfreaks*?" She c..."
links.text: "You mean the *speedfreaks*?" She closes her eyes, as more dance music invades the holy silence of the sanctuary.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Of course, the speedfreaks... They..."
links.text: "Of course, the speedfreaks... They have a *fantastic* sound system. And you think they would help me?"

links.title: You: ""They *would* if you wouldn't mind..."
links.text: "They *would* if you wouldn't mind them moving in with you."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I guess I could live through a wee..."
links.text: "I guess I could live through a week or two of peaceful coexistence."

links.title: Suggestion: "Brilliant negotiating there, detect..."
links.text: Brilliant negotiating there, detective -- as always!

links.title: You: ""Great, I'll go talk to them then.""
links.text: "Great, I'll go talk to them then."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Sure, let me know how it goes." Sh..."
links.text: "Sure, let me know how it goes." She lingers for a moment, before adding: "Thanks, officer."

links.title: You: ""Sure, if you agree to let them bui..."
links.text: "Sure, if you agree to let them build their drug lab."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No, officer, I don't *agree* to an..."
links.text: "No, officer, I don't *agree* to anything."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She pauses, looking you in the eye."
links.text: She pauses, looking you in the eye.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "That's a bummer. A *big* bummer."
links.text: That's a bummer. A *big* bummer.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""But most of the time I'm fully abs..."
links.text: "But most of the time I'm fully absorbed in my work with the radiocomputer," she then goes on, "and there are still parts of the church I haven't had time to explore, so..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "What she means is that she's ready..."
links.text: What she means is that she's ready to turn a blind eye if the need arises.

links.title: You: "Yes, but can I *hear* anything?"
links.text: Yes, but can I *hear* anything?

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Still nothing. Soona isn't even loo..."
links.text: Still nothing. Soona isn't even looking at you this time.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "All you hear is your own breathing,..."
links.text: All you hear is your own breathing, heavy and hoarse from all the nights spent drinking... It's the breath of an old man.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "But there's something else..."
links.text: But there's something else...

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "There *has* to be. Something big, s..."
links.text: There *has* to be. Something big, something unexpected... something *new*, yet to be discovered.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Ghosts, speak to me!"
links.text: Ghosts, speak to me!

links.title: Conceptualization: "When was the last time this world h..."
links.text: When was the last time this world had anything new to say?

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Well?" Soona asks as soon as you t..."
links.text: "Well?" Soona asks as soon as you take off the headphones. "Did you hear anything?"

links.title: You: ""No, nothing. It's just silence.""
links.text: "No, nothing. It's just silence."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yeah..." Her voice is bitter with..."
links.text: "Yeah..." Her voice is bitter with disappointment.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks down at the fl..."
links.text: The lieutenant looks down at the floor, as if to say you're wasting time here.

links.title: Suggestion: "Maybe the speedfreaks can help you..."
links.text: Maybe the speedfreaks can help you with this? Go talk with Andre.

links.title: You: ""I'm not sure... There seems to be..."
links.text: "I'm not sure... There seems to be something there, but I couldn't really make it out."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yeah... No, I don't think there's..."
links.text: "Yeah... No, I don't think there's anything there." Her voice is bitter with disappointment.

links.title: You: ""Now that the ravers are settled in..."
links.text: "Now that the ravers are settled in, can you help me contact Coalition Warship Archer?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It's true, the drug fiends have ma..."
links.text: "It's true, the drug fiends have made themselves quite comfortable. But *I* still have a great deal of work to do..."

links.title: Empathy: "This project is immensely important..."
links.text: This project is immensely important to her. She's not going to help you until it's finished.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""If you're desperate for collaborat..."
links.text: "If you're desperate for collaborators now, I suggest you ask your new friends. They seem to have plenty of time for side projects."

links.title: You: ""Now that your project is finished,..."
links.text: "Now that your project is finished, can you help me contact Coalition Warship Archer?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "She looks up from her monitor. "You..."
links.text: She looks up from her monitor. "You're asking me to circuit-bend onto Coalition radio frequencies. You want to know is it possible? Probably. But is it a good idea? I'm not so sure..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""The main difficulty will be findin..."
links.text: "The main difficulty will be finding an antenna powerful enough to reach those frequencies. Unfortunately you can't exactly buy mega-longwave antennas off the shelf."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""She's not joking. Even the RCM has..."
links.text: "She's not joking. Even the RCM has to receive special approval from the Coalition to access that kind of equipment."

links.title: You: ""The radio relay tower at Land's En..."
links.text: "The radio relay tower at Land's End... could that work?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I highly doubt it. That tower is b..."
links.text: "I highly doubt it. That tower is barely able to transmit short-wave signals across the bay. To generate mega-low frequencies, we're going to need a *much* larger antenna..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""There is an old radio relay tower..."
links.text: "There is an old radio relay tower at the very end of the peninsula. It's mostly used to coordinate boat traffic in the harbour, but it's possible that it's equipped to handle mega-low frequencies as well..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Assuming the relay isn't too badly..."
links.text: "Assuming the relay isn't too badly damaged, that is. I have work to do here, but I recommend you examine the relay tower and return once you have determined its condition."

links.title: You: ""Where is this relay tower exactly?""
links.text: "Where is this relay tower exactly?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""North of here. Follow the coastlin..."
links.text: "North of here. Follow the coastline. I do not know how to explain it more simply."

links.title: You: ""Alright, I'll check out the tower..."
links.text: "Alright, I'll check out the tower and report back."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Very good. I'll be here when you a..."
links.text: "Very good. I'll be here when you are finished."

links.title: You: ""It's not a *paying* job, but could..."
links.text: "It's not a *paying* job, but could you help me contact Coalition Warship Archer?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Do I look like someone who has tim..."
links.text: "Do I look like someone who has time for *side projects* at this moment?" She doesn't even look up from her computer.

links.title: Empathy: "If you want her help, maybe you sho..."
links.text: If you want her help, maybe you should help *her* first...

links.title: You: ""I wasn't kidding earlier about con..."
links.text: "I wasn't kidding earlier about contacting Coalition Warship Archer. Can you help me?"

links.title: You: ""Right, I'll let you work in peace..."
links.text: "Right, I'll let you work in peace now." [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes, what is it?" She doesn't look..."
dialogueTree.text: "Yes, what is it?" She doesn't look up from the keyboard.

dialogueTree.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""What is it?" The woman is still hu..."
dialogueTree.text: "What is it?" The woman is still hunched over the keyboard, gently illuminated by the purring machine.

links.title: You: ""I didn't break anything, did I?""
links.text: "I didn't break anything, did I?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No, you just printed out my person..."
links.text: "No, you just printed out my personal log and wasted some paper." It does not look like a big loss to her.

links.title: You: ""Hey, are you the lead programmer o..."
links.text: "Hey, are you the lead programmer of 'Wirrâl Untethered' by any chance?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Yes." She thinks to herself. "Or n..."
links.text: "Yes." She thinks to herself. "Or no, not anymore. That project is dead."

links.title: Empathy: "She doesn't seem surprised to be re..."
links.text: She doesn't seem surprised to be recognized, rather sad. Something passes over her face before she straightens her back.

links.title: You: ""Sorry, but... who *are* you? What..."
links.text: "Sorry, but... who *are* you? What are you doing here?"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I am Soona Luukanen-Kilde, the for..."
links.text: "I am Soona Luukanen-Kilde, the former lead programmer of Fortress Accident and RSA Radios. I have over 16 years of programming experience and I'm proficient in both Vox and Orbis languages..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""If you're not here to hire me, I d..."
links.text: "If you're not here to hire me, I don't really know how can I help you." She turns back to the terminal.

links.title: Logic: "Did she say *over 16 years of exper..."
links.text: Did she say *over 16 years of experience*? She must have started programming when she was still a teenager.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "That still doesn't answer what she'..."
links.text: That still doesn't answer what she's doing in an abandoned church.

links.title: You: ""Nothing, I'll let you work." [Leav..."
links.text: "Nothing, I'll let you work." [Leave.]
